loans.name: Mabona Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a widow, aged 32 years, from Maboona, a suburb in the Isingiro district. She dropped out of school and got married when she was young. At the age of 35, with four children, the husband passed away, leaving her with no source of income to support the family. 

She acquired a loan of 800,000, and started up a food stall in the market in order to survive and also to cater for her children. This business grew and helped her to sustain her family. This prompted her to mobilize her colleagues to form a group called Maboona Tutungukye group. They started different businesses, and with the help of Ugafode loans, their businesses have progressed. They are requesting a loan to help them increase their business working capital to improve their standards of living. 

Jackline will use the loan to restock her food stall. This will help her to meet her customers' demands, and also increase her income. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy plantain, irish potatoes, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a young, 25-year-old woman from the region of Kapsowar, an area that is marginalized by violence but full of persons that want to overcome this history, turn a new leaf over and begin working for their future. One of these persons is Joan, who started farming five years ago. She is a proud mother of two lovely school-going children that she really values and treasures and will go an extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Joan’s primary source of income has been milk selling, crop farming, and poultry farming; through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been practicing farming for five years, and through those years she has never regretted venturing into farming. Joan sells her products to the nearby market; that is vegetables, eggs, and milk. She has a challenge of timely delivery of the products and also meeting the demand that exists. She is always forced to walk for long distances to reach the market, and this really affects her. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the loan she will be able to deliver her products in a timely manner. Her products are perishable so they require quick delivery and the motorbike will offer that. 

Joan’s dream is to get out of the poverty levels, and she is sure that through this loan she will be able to realize her dream. She would like to empower others economically, and she plans to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farming activities and through this she will improve her living standards. Through the saving culture that Joan has, she will repay the loan and increase her business of farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market.

loans.name: Benadeta Elikana

texts.en:
Benadeta is 23 years old and the mother of twins. She lives with her parents and siblings in the Gairo District of Tanzania. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping students understand their wellbeing and teaching them life skills, which will encourage them to improve their learning performance. 

Aside from this, Benadeta is a young businesswoman who sells groceries in a retail shop near her home. The profits she obtains have been used to help her parents with their daily needs and to buy food. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase products in bulk, which will increase her profit margin. Benadeta plans to use the profits obtained from the loan to provide for the basic needs of her children as well as continue to provide for her parents.

loans.use: to purchase products in bulk, which will increase her profit margin

loans.name: Philip Mugwere

texts.en:
Philip is a 37 years old male working as a business development manager at a local microfinance institution. He is married with 3 children.

Traditional cookstoves cause a lot of indoor air pollution, leading to respiratory diseases. Traditional stoves also consume a lot of charcoal.

Currently on average, Philip spends USD 1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable him purchase high efficient cook stoves- JIKOKOA - that will save him up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. This cook stove also reduces smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for his family.

The family will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal. This translates to USD 234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove).

loans.use: to purchase a high efficient improved cook stove

loans.name: Defrim

texts.en:
Defrim is 22 years old and single, living with his parents. He is currently a student but is also involved in agricultural work with his father. Together, they plant corn and wheat on land to sell and to use for their own family. 

This business is their main source of income, but the profit it generates is too low to be able to meet their needs and address the renovation needs of their home. They have never had the opportunity to replace the windows and doors and are requesting a loan to do so before the upcoming winter season. 

Defrim’s goal is to be able to finish his studies and find a regular job. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to replace windows and doors

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a smallholder farmer based in Mosombor, near Nandi Hills, in Kenya. He is married to a hardworking wife. The couple has worked tirelessly on their 2.3 acre farmland for the last 14 years. Together they have been able to provide a decent life for their 4 children.

Joel is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and farm implements. For the 23 years he has been farming, he feels this is the right time to venture into poultry farming because of the steady rise in egg demand. The tools are intended to replace the old tools he is currently using to cultivate tea and maize. The new tools he is going for are much more improved in design and handling. Better tools will produce a better quality of work, which will be reflected during the harvesting period. 

Income from this investment will help the Joel's family pull themselves out of poverty through food security and better education for the children.

loans.use: buy poultry and farm implements

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en:
Sadaina is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has two additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

Sadaina sells used clothes on a retail basis at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She has no additional source of income. She sells seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires of owning a fully stocked shop selling different types of used clothes and shoes. 

Sadaina decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian was born in 1977. She is a woman who always tries to work hard for the well-being of her family. She works hard to help her husband because together they are responsible for taking care of their four children. 

Vivian always wanted to have her own business. She began her business selling cooked beans, fried plantain and gari (cassava flour) 11 years ago. Little by little, she developed her business. She successfully runs her own business. 

Vivian wants to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of GHS 2,000 to buy more beans, ripe plantains, charcoal, and cooking oil, so as to cook and sell for increasing her working capital. This is her fifth loan cycle with ID Ghana and her first with Kiva. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more beans, ripe plantains, charcoal, and cooking oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is Margaret, forty-five years old and a mother of four children. She owns and runs a cafe. 

Margaret joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in December, 2013. She is grateful for the training in business record-keeping, savings, enterprise development and financial management she received. These skills help her manage her cafe effectively. 

Margaret is borrowing 10,000 KES to enable her to buy more stocks of flour and cooking oil for her cafe so she can meet the rising demands of her business. The anticipated income will enable her to meet her family’s basic needs and pay school fees for her children with ease.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva lenders and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zilipher

texts.en:
Zilipher is 28 years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria State of South Sudan. She is married and has two children. 

For the past four years, she has been working hard to manage her produce, selling onions, oil, and sweet potatoes. 

Zilipher has requested a loan of 1,400 SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to purchase more goods like onions, tomatoes and others, and it will help Zilipher to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. 

Zilipher hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 42 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her boutique in which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different types of clothes for sale, and will help Dorothy to generate greater profits and improve the business standards. Dorothy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into wholesale. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorothy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more different types of clothes for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. 

For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop, in which he sells essential items, like sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items to sell and will help John to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. 

John hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand the business into wholesale. 

John is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like John, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Ana Myrna

texts.en: Ana Myrna  is 51 years old, married, the mother of three children and lives in Tukuran,  Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has a retail store where she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate income while her husband works as a driver. Ana Myrna has been in this field for the last five years, and works hard every day to provide income for her family and improve its living situation. She has requested this loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and grains to sell in her store in order to increase her sales. She wants to develop her business and increase her profits so that she can renovate their house and have her family live there comfortably.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cathelyn

texts.en: Cathelyn is 28 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her animals. Cathelyn has been raising pigs for the last year, and has taken out three prior loans from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary hails from KIambu County Kenya. She is a mother of three children and small scale farmer with a keen interest in dairy farming. With over 10 years experience in farming, she has adequate knowledge to move her dairy business to greater heights of growth. 

Mary had developed her dairy cow to a breed that was producing 20 kilos of milk per day but it died a month ago leaving behind a young calve. With her passion for dairy farming and a focus to grow her agribusiness venture, she is requesting for a loan to buy another cow to replace the deceased one.

A loan from Kiva will support Mary acquire a dairy cow capable of producing over 20 kilos of milk per day.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to replace one that died

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking mother of four who lives in Kapsumai location in the North Rift region of Kenya. She is a hardened crop farmer who is struggling with farm-related expenses. She has been doing this work for three years. Grace noted that the crop's performance is heavily reliant on external factors such as weather. For this reason, farmers usually realize they have lost a great percentage of their crops during harvest.

To make the investment worthwhile, a farmer has to make up for the foreseeable crop losses by working on a significant area of land. Grace is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 that will enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to grow more crops in the coming season. She believes this loan will increase food security in her home.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer to increase her crop cultivation

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is single and a mother of three children who all attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Luciana is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards and raise school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She was born in 1983 in Kirinyaga county, Kenya. She is married with three children. Without any formal employment, horticulture farming has helped her face the challenge of providing for her family. She has seen progression in her farming and has been able to meet the basic need of the family without much struggle. Her dream is to grow her agribusiness activities to a big enterprise where she will transport products using her own pick-up vehicle.

A loan from Kiva will fast track her business growth towards achieving her dream.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her cabbages and french beans crops

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in primary school. Charles works very hard to provide for their needs and school fees. He is operating a grinding mill in for the past six years.

Charles requested a loan of 4,500 SSP through WOYE MFI to buy another grinding mill because his customer base is growing. He would like to save enough to provide for his family and the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy another grinding mill

loans.name: Petrolina

texts.en:
For the last 20 years Petrolina has been engaged in farming activity. She grows a variety of food crops and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is married and has been blessed with three, school-going children.

She has applied for her first loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for use in her farm, for better crop yields. Petronilla will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as responsible. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the meals. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her prepared meal business.

loans.name: Mariah

texts.en:
Mariah is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as honest. She operates an M-PESA business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years now. Mariah's business is located in a competitive location, and her customers are of all types. 

Mariah describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use her 20,000 KES loan in order to grow to her M-PESA business. 

Mariah's business goal is to own many M-PESA shops within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add to her M-PESA business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, salt, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with high demand. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be a leading wholesaler. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt and other items for his grocery stall

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 63, is a hardened and experienced smallholder from Eldoret, Kenya. She has four decades of experience in farming. The mother of eight keeps four cows that produce milk for family consumption and sale. She is also active in maize cultivation and trade. Her main income sources are milk and maize. 

Esther is seeking a loan to develop her six-acre farm. She will use the loan to build a greenhouse that will create an ideal microenvironment for crop development.

She will leverage the great network of relationships she has developed over the years as a maize trader to market and sell her greenhouse produce. Increased income from this investment will help her pay for other farm related expenses and build her savings account for future investments.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 30 years old. He is married and has 4 children aged between 3 and 12 years, all of them go to school. He has a bar and has been running this  business for 12 years. With this loan, he would like to buy beer, soda, juice and water for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas & water

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old now.

Emelinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Emelinda has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 8 and 13 years old, all of go school. She sells spare parts. She has been in business for 5 years.  

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more spare parts for for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy perfumes, accessories, makeup, and incense to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old, and married with 2 children between the ages of 2 months and 4 years old, they do not yet attend school.  He has been in the clothing retail business for 10 years.  

With the loan, he would like to buy t-shirts and trousers for resale.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and trousers for resale.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 44-year-old woman who ives with her husband and seven children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to save money so that she can provide better living conditions to her children, but this is impossible without a profitable source of income. Her husband has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He also needs to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient cash on hand to do this. Therefore, Zareena has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy a new motor rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to maintain a motor rickshaw and its body.

loans.name: Chanrey

texts.en: Chanrey is a 25-year-old university student who is majoring in economics. She is from Svay Reang province in Cambodia. Because she is short of financial support, she has applied for a loan to pay her tuition. With this loan, she will be able to graduate. Her goal for the future is to get a good job and a bigger house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 43 years old and a mother of 4 children. She and her husband run a local palm oil mill in her village. This mill has been a source of support for her and her family, and other members of the village who are mostly farmers. At the moment, the mill lacks a fiber separator, equipment that is used to separate kernels from fiber. This is very challenging because it takes lots of hours using the manual process. To reduce her frustration and that of her clients, and also make life easier for manual workers who make their daily living in this mill, Roseline is requesting this loan from Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society to enable her purchase this equipment and other equipment she needs at the mill.

If this mill is upgraded, Roseline hopes that she will be able to serve farmers in the village which their livelihood depend on farming and palm oil processing and she will also earn more income to support her  family especially her children school fees and other necessities.

She appreciates all Kiva lenders who support her.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil processing equipment

loans.name: Rolando Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 13 De Diciembre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive el señor Rolando, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 3 años  de edad, los 3 mayores estudian en escuela. Su mujer es ama de casa.
Don Rolando  es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir, el se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  pollos y gallinas criollas, el se desplaza hasta una granja de localidad y compra los pollos al por mayor, luego los lleva a vender a personas y tiendas de la ciudad  ya sea enteros o por libras, lleva 2 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y gallinas. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the canton of Olmedo, every 15 days the “13th of December” loan group meets. This place is known for its beautiful paths and for its hard-working people, who are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals.

In this place, lives Mr. Rolando. He is 31 years old and is in a common-law marriage, and, from this relationship, he has four children who are 10, 8, 6, and 3 years old. The older ones study in school. His wife is a housewife.

Rolando is a very responsible and hard-working man who does what is possible so that his family doesn’t lack what they need to live. He is dedicated to business, buying and selling chickens and local hens. He goes to a farm in the area and buys chickens wholesale there. Then, he brings the chickens to sell to people and stores in the city; he sells them whole or by the pound. He has spent 2 years doing this work, with which he makes a living.

This loan is to buy chickens and hens. He has been in his loan group for 2 years, and he likes it, since the loans have financed his business. His dreams are to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy local chickens and hens.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados que esta cerca de su casa y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Ana es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas cerdos y asi poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old. She has spent many years dedicated to raising pigs. She sells the pigs in different markets that are near her house, and with the sales she has made, she has succeeded in going forward with the household expenses. Ana is a single mother, and she lives in her own house with her son. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more pigs and, thus, so that she can continue with raising the pigs and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marisa is 41 years old.

Marisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 4,600 loan amount through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Nenalyn

texts.en:
Nenalyn is 45 years old and married with twelve children. Six of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nenalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Nenalyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is 30 years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She is married and has four children. For the past four years, Nomi has been working hard to manage her products, selling water, oil and cigarettes.  

To help expand her business, Nomi has requested a loan of 300 SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to purchase these goods to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. 

Nomi hopes that in the future, she will be able to operate a large scale business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy instruments for her dentistry practice.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and married. She has seven children, with two children in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etcetera. Virginia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a widowed mother and works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle-passenger business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store. Melinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle-passenger business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through the past 8 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar was born in 1957 year. She lives with her family in a rural area. Muyassar has two, adult children. She always tries for the well-being of her family.

Muyassar during many years has been busy with an agriculture business. She feeds cows and also grows onions, melons, watermelons, and other crops, on a seven-hectare parcel of land. She has a great farming deal and works hard. Muyassar has a big cowshed at her house. She sells cows in a local market. Thanks to the good condition of her cows, she has regular customers in the local market. Muyassar’s sons are migrants in Russia. Her husband helps her with managing the business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni. She will use the loan to buy cows, for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy more cows and increase her working capital

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
This is Feruza. She is a dairy farmer in Tajikistan. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area. 

She developed a passion for cows from her father. The cows produced milk that she sold to the locals. She also sold the cattle to get school fees for her children. Feruza has been busy with this business more than 15 years. She has a great experience in this field. 

Feruza has plans to grow her business to become a recognized dairy farmer in Tajikistan. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy cows. She will have a high milk production, higher incomes, and also provide employment to many. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cows for increasing working capital

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân is 48 years old and she is married with three children, but supports no dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has a retail business selling tapes and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygieinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Clementina, 48 years old is married with six children. She has her retail business to make more income for a living. Before, she often helped her husband working and raising pigs until she was engaged in retailing goods for more income. She has now borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase more variety of vegetables to sell in her store. She is hoping to make expansion to her business and build a bigger shelter for her convenience store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Norie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 42 years of age, is a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Chuka. It is a remote town, with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married, and together with her husband has two lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk, poultry, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Mary is a tough woman with tough skin, and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling.

The Chuka area has conditions that favor dairy farming. Mary has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow, but a lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a breed that produces between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. With this cow Mary's farm will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Chuka area is high, but the supply is low. So, through this loan Mary is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Mary to provide a secure future for her school-going children, by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. His vision is to keep even more dairy cows, so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Reina Esmeralda

texts.es: Reina de 41 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 20 años se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en su vivienda, además hace remiendos para obtener mejores ingresos por la experiencia con la que cuenta, Reina cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus servicios. Ella es madre soltera y habita desde hace 10 años en vivienda propia, junto a su hija de 14 años de edad. Reina desea invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de cubrecamas, forros y fundas para vender, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: telas, hilos, agujas y zipper para elaborar fundas, cubrecamas y forros para vender y obtener así mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Reina, who is 41 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman who for 20 years has earned a living making articles of clothing in her home. In addition, she does repairs to obtain more income. Because of the experience that she has, Reina has a large number of customers who always seek her services. 

She is a single mother and has lived in her own house for 10 years, along with her 14-year-old daughter. 

Reina wants to invest in basic supplies to make bedcovers, pillowcases, and slipcovers to sell, but she doesn't have the necessary economic liquidity. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in fabric, thread, needles, and zippers to make slipcovers, bedcovers, and pillowcases to sell and thus obtain more economic income.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics, thread, needles, and zippers

loans.name: Algrace

texts.en: Algrace is married with only one child. She earns a living from selling rice and corn grits in the market. Her earnings go to her child's education costs. She earns well from this and is able to sustain the business. To increase her capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell. She hopes to buy a vehicle to be used for their business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman from Mayorga, Leyte. She has three grown children. She engages in farming. 

Marcelina grows and sells rice. She is pictured standing in front of her newly-harvested rice. She also engages in raising and selling of hogs. These are her sources of income. 

She needs capital to sustain her farming business, so she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and medicine. These supplies will help her produce a larger harvest and high quality rice. 

In the future, Marcelina would like to expand her business to improve the family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is aged 28, married to a driver, and blessed with three children. 

She has owned and managed a transportation  business in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 600 daily. Her net income goes to their savings. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Fedelina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Fedelina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 60 years old and has six children. She is a widowed woman who works very hard to provide for them.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulina has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Morena Lisseth

texts.es:
Morena de 31 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta el 6° grado, esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura mientras que Morena se dedica a la venta de frutas, manzanas, naranjas, guineos, papaya, piña etc. y verduras zanahoria, papas, plátanos, desde hace 8 años, oficio que lo aprendió de su madrecita quien siempre se dedico a esto; para llegar a su negocio Morena viaja en bus 5 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm todos los días.

El préstamo solicitado en la institución, es para comprar 2 vacas lecheras, con ello lograra vender la leche y obtener un poco mas de ganancias para poder darle a su grupo familiar una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Morena es construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que en la que vive por el momento es de su suegra.
texts.en:
Morena is a 31-year-old housewife who studied through the sixth grade. She is married and the mother of two children, ages 2 and 1. Morena lives with her husband and children. Her husband works in agriculture while she sells fruits such as apples, oranges, bananas, papayas, pineapples, and other products, as well as vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, and plantains. She has been in this business for eight years and learned this trade from her mother who was always in this line of work. To get to her job, Morena must travel five kilometers by bus. Her work schedule every day is from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy two dairy cows. As a result, she will be able to sell milk and earn a bit more income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family. Morena dreams of building a brick house since she currently lives with her mother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows so that she can sell milk and earn more income.

loans.name: Tevan

texts.en:
Tevan lives in the unbelievably beautiful village Srashen of Syunik region. As he says, he is a happy father of three clever, cheerful, and brave boys, who are still school-aged. 

Tevan got married very early and, since he became the head of the family, he established a nice farm, where he takes care of 13 sheep, 4 lambs (he keeps them in a barn built by himself), and 20 chickens. He also has large plot of land, part of which gives him a harvest of vegetables (tomato, cucumber, beans, onions, and greens)  and also a colorful orchard with a sweet harvest of apple, plums, peaches, persimmons, and figs. 

All his farm work he does properly and with care. He also manages to work at farms in his village, being paid for doing different work there, such as harvest gathering or some land cultivation. So he catches any chance to earn more money for his big and lovely family. 

Tevan’s wife works as a cleaner at the local school. Tevan needs this loan in order to organize autumn sowing activities and impatiently waits for this loan in order to start.

loans.use: to organize autumn sowing activities

loans.name: Basheera

texts.en:
Basheera belongs to a poor family. She lives with her spouse and six children, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories for doors and windows, which are usable in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services, to weld broken accessories. A few days ago his welding plant became out of order, due to overheating. It needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses.

Therefore, Basheera has requested a loan from BRAC (which is an active field partner of Kiva), so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing. Basheera sends thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for manufacturing window and door hardware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a room at her house.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 56-year-old married mother of five children who has worked in tailoring for thirty years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family.

Fatima is trying desperately to provide her family with better living conditions; thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house and make it a healthier and better for her children. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa has been  running a buy-and-sell business in order to provide  the needs of her  children. She sell assorted groceries and vegetables in their village to make a living.

She is a widow, 65 years old, and had to survive with her children who helped her in their business. To improve sales, she took another loan to purchase more grocery goods and grocery goods  to resell. In the future, Generosa wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods and grocery goods  to resell

loans.name: Olida

texts.en:
Olida lives in a rural area. She was born in the year 1956. She is widowed and has a son. She is very hardworking and kind-natured. She has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.

Olida has been farming for 15 years, producing wheat and potatoes. Her products are sold at the local market in the region. 

In order to provide her crops with the needed attention, Olida is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 TJS to buy coal and wood to keep her house warm. She is only feeder and keeper of her family and she really needs your financial support. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood to keep her house warm

loans.name: Meraflor

texts.en:
Meraflor is 45 years old and has five children. She is a married woman.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Meraflor has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Murzaim

texts.ru: Мурзаим 48 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Мурзаим достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме свыше 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Мурзаим имеется 2 коровы. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Мурзаим планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Murzaim is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and she's been raising livestock for many years already.  Thanks to her very hard work and constant labor, she has managed to greatly develop her farming business, and she now makes a monthly income of over 20,000 som (KGS).  She currently owns two cows.  Her husband and children help her with the farm work.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC  and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock.  Murzaim is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her cattle headcount and also to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her cattle headcount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wholesale coconuts

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Don Paulino de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 9 años y los comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos pequeños y concentrado para seguir con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 58-year-old Paulino lives in his own house with his mother. For the past nine years he has made a living by raising chickens and selling them in the surrounding villages. He manages to support himself with what he obtains from his sales. He is requesting a loan in order to buy young chickens and chicken feed so he can continue with his work and have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and metal sheets so she can add another room to her house

loans.name: Rosa Hortencia

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 13 De Diciembre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Rosa, tiene 46 años de edad, está soltera y vive con sus padres. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos cada día mejora su negocio.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante y ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 20 años, como le gusta el comercio vende ropa puerta a puerta, pero hace 5 años arrendo un local en el centro del cantón donde vive y surtió una  tienda de viveras de consumo, allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, allí también vende ropa de todo tipo, trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones le ayudan sus padres aunque es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda y ropa de todo tipo. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que en el que  está tienen que pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
The loan group "Thirteenth of December" meets every two weeks in the Olmedo canton. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and animal raising.

Señorita Rosa lives in this place. She is 46 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She has been in the loan group for four years, and she likes it because with the loans, her business improves every day.

Doña Rosa is a woman who likes to work to thus get ahead and help her parents, who are of scarce resources. She has worked in commerce for 20 years. As she liked business, she sold clothing door to door, but five years ago she rented a shop in the center of the canton where she lives and stocked a store with supplies for consumption. There she sells all types of products of basic necessity, such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents, among other things. There she also sells clothing of all types. She works every day, and sometimes her parents help her, although she is the one who spends the most time at her business.

She is going to use this loan to buy groceries to stock her store more and also to buy clothing of all types. Her dreams are to have her own shop, since she has to pay rent for the one she is in now.

loans.use: to buy groceries and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым, 52 года, замужем, многодетная мать 5 детей, они все взрослые и самостоятельные. Гулайым уже более 20 лет занимается разведением скота, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы и 30 овец. Также на участке мерою 1,59 Га она выращивает клевер и кукурузу, есть сад, в сезон Гулайым продает фрукты. В целях развития своей деятельности Гулайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Это позволит Гулайым приумножить поголовье скота. В будущем, она мечтает построить большой дом.
texts.en: Gulaiym is 52 years old, married, and the mother of a large family (she has five children).  All her children are adult and independent.  Gulaiym has been raising livestock for more than 20 years already and she currently owns two cows and 30 sheep.  In addition, she grows clover and corn on 1.59 hectare of land, and she also has a garden which allows her to sell fruits depending on the season.  In order to increase her activity, Gulaiym has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to increase her livestock headcount.  In the future, she is dreaming of building a big house.

loans.use: to purchase additional bull-calves in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 31-year-old mother who operates a business in South Sudan.  She has been married for three years. 

She has been working hard to manage the work. Angelina  requested a  600 SSP loan through WOYE/MFI  to increase her business. She is a clothes seller in the town of Mundri.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An has a service business, shipping goods. He has been involved in this business for seven years.

He is 30 years old, and he is married with one child. An lives with his family in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that An faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, An hopes for his business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his kids. He wants his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Sorphorn is 29 years old and a fourth-year engineering student at university. He is from the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. He has worked as a security guard since 2013, earning approximately $5 a day.

Due to a shortage in finances, Sorphorn would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fee. With the loan, he will be able to graduate successfully. After graduation, he wants to get a good job to save money and build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Zirapa

texts.ru: Зирапа, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Зирапа в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1977 году. Благодаря упорному труду Зирапы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,20 Га, где Зирапа со своей семьей выращивают ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы для разведения. Доходы от кредита Зирапа вложит в расширение бизнеса и она хочет построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Zirapa is 54 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this business in 1977.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows and 15 sheep.  She also uses 1.2 hectare of allotted land on which she and her family grow barley.  Eager to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of one cow for breeding.  Zirapa is planning to use the earnings from her loan to expand her business.  She also wants to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to further grow her business.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 34 years old and married, with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for five years.

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygieinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jaime Alexander

texts.es: Jaime de 31 años de edad se dedica desde hace 14 años se dedica a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo,  Jaime está solicitando un crédito para la compra de redes y trasmallos, ya que los que tiene están deteriorados y asi el podrá seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jaime, who is 31 years old, has done artisanal fishing for 14 years. He sells his products in the neighboring towns and has many customers. With what he obtains from his sales, he manages to pay some household expenses. He lives in his own house with his life companion and their son. Jaime is applying for a loan to purchase nets and trammel nets, since the ones he has are deteriorated, and this way he will be able to continue with his work in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy nets and trammel nets.

loans.name: Tỉnh

texts.en:
Tỉnh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tỉnh is 40 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tỉnh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tỉnh faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tỉnh hopes for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 37-year-old single woman who has worked in her clothing sales shop for five years to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Today, Maysaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes, which will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs, and to attract new ones.

Maysaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Welem

texts.en:
Welem is a 45-year-old man who is married to Adriana, a 40-year-old woman. They are blessed with two sons and two daughters namely: Tomy, 17, a senior high school student grade 1st; Melki, 15, a 3rd grade student of junior high school; Ester, 13, a 1st grade student of junior high school; and the last is Debora, 8, an elementary school student grade 3rd. 

Welem has a chicken breeding business while his wife, Adriana, works as a nonpermanent teacher. Previously, Welem was a fishmonger. Then he decided to stop, and started a new business to breed and sell chickens. He started this business in 2009 with his own capital. 

Currently, he wants to develop his business by purchasing more chickens to be sold, but he has limited money to do so. Therefore, he applies for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 3,000,000. The loan is used to purchase more chickens.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 39 years old and married with four children. She operates the farm they own to earn a living. 

She requested a loan from GDMPC to cover the costs of farm fertilization and weeding maintenance. She has operated her farm for many years, earning enough to support the family and pay for her children's education. In the future, she wants to buy farmland for a better source of income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilization and weeding.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 50-year-old widow who lives with three of her children. Their ages are 25, 22, and 3 years old. The oldest is a college student,the second already got a job and is working, and the last one is not attending school yet.  

As the breadwinner for her family, Damaris works hard in producing income to fulfill the needs of her family. She even worked in the neighboring country  as a laborer for the sake of her children’s welfare. Then Damaris returned in 2012 and  initiated a pig breeding business as the new business hope for her family. 

The business is running well; however, sometimes she deals with business capital.  Last week she applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to buy more piglets and fodder. She believes that the more piglets she raises, the more profit she will get.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and fodder

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 56 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Asha is a widow in her mid-30s with four children. Two are still in school and two are grown up. She has been a food vendor for six months now. She works from 6am to 4pm daily and makes a small monthly profit.

This is Asha's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her mamalishe (Swahili for "mother nutrition") stock  and has paid it back successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock her business.

Asha dreams of owning a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group Limousine, which consists of four members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her business.

loans.name: Yulikristi

texts.en:
Yulikristi is a 40-year-old single parent with four children. Their names are: Sartika, 22, who is now studying at University; Randy, 19, a worker; Benyamin, 15, a 3rd grade student of senior high school; and Mariska, 14, a special school student grade 5th.

Yulikristi works hard to earn a living for herself and her four children. She has had a laundry business since 2004. Regularly, she picks up the dirty clothes from the customers and brings them back to the customers after the clothes have been cleaned. Sometimes, she washes the clothes by hand  for special color, which also needs special treatment, but mostly she uses washing machines. She also uses special laundry perfume and irons the clothes. 

She is willing to expand her business by obtaining additional capital. So she applies for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 3,000,000. The loan is used to purchase laundry perfume and other laundry necessities.

loans.use: to purchase laundry perfume and other laundry necessities

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 23-year-old single man; he decided three years ago to benefit from his 11 years of experience in baking and open his own bakery shop in order to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions.

Today, Mohsen is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business by buying new necessary baking tools, which will facilitate his work and allow him to provide his customers with quick and better service. 

Mohsen hopes to expand his business more in the future, and open another branch to increase his income and improve his social and financial living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new necessary baking tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick for flooring, cement, sand, and gravel to install a brick floor and to improve the walls of her home.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel Ángel es padre soltero de dos hijos que ya no están en Nicaragua junto a él sino que viven en Costa Rica. Trabaja como zapatero y con este ingreso se mantiene a sí mismo y adicionalmente ayuda a su hermano quien tiene un problema de retraso mental. Con tantos años en su oficio su máquina de coser ya se puso muy antigua y los trabajos que realiza ya no le salen como antes. Para poder realizar un mejor trabajo y satisfacer a sus clientes Miguel Ángel solicita este crédito para poder reemplazar su antigua máquina de coser por una nueva y más moderna que le permita seguir desempeñando su labor de manera correcta.
texts.en:
Don Miguel Ángel is a single father of two children who are no longer living with him in Nicaragua. They now live in Costa Rica. Miguel works as a cobbler so that he can earn income to support himself. In addition, he helps his brother who suffers from mental retardation.

After being in this trade for years, his sewing machine is now very old and he cannot complete his work as timely as before. In order to do a better job and satisfy his customers, Miguel Ángel is requesting this loan so that he can replace his old sewing machine with a new one that is more modern. As a result, he can continue performing his work properly.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine so that he can provide good service to his customers and continue his work as a cobbler.

loans.name: Gulina

texts.ru: Гулина, 57 лет, вдова, многодетная мама 6 детей, младший сын живет с Гулиной, помогает ей во всем. У Гулины среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии. Она по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гулины в хозяйстве имеется: 3 коровы, 12 овец, 6 коз и 2 лошади. Ее деятельность приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Гулине хочется помогать ее детям и внукам, а так как сельское хозяйство для нее - это единственный источник дохода, она в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, что позволит ей увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Gulina is 57, widowed, and a mother of many children; she has six in total, and her youngest son currently lives with her and helps her in every way possible.  Character-wise, Gulina is calm, even-keeled and hardworking.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and has raised livestock for several years as her main source of income, which she also supplements with a pension.  She first started ten years ago, and thanks to her persistent efforts, currently has three cows, twelve sheep, six goats and two horses on her farm, while her monthly income is roughly 5,000 som.  All the same, this isn't nearly enough money to provide her and her family with a decent standard of living.  She wants to help her children and grandchildren, and as farming is her only major source of income, she's seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to add ten more sheep to her farm, and plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further expand her farm and bring in even more money for her family.

loans.use: buy ten sheep to expand her business and increase her family's income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hides and other materials for making drums

loans.name: Hurbiby

texts.en:
Hurbiby is a 26-year-old married mother. She is a very enterprising woman. She constantly struggles to raise her three children, who are the center of her life. For more than six years, she has been busy with animal husbandry. Her honesty, responsibility and punctuality have been the reasons for her job success, and she believes she is doing well because she always gives the best of herself. 

Hurbiby is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and finishing the building. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life, and she will continue working hard to give her children a better education, and to see them later become excellent professionals.

loans.use: To buy building materials for finishing the building of the house

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 48 and she is married. She lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Zubaida purchases clothes at cheap rates, with the help of her husband, and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this since 2004, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to the upcoming winter season, the demand for clothing will increase as well. 

This is the reason Zubaida showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively, and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell from her home.

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ireen, a hard-working, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. 

Ireen is the proud mother of two lovely children that she really loves and adores and always protects. Ireen’s upbringing was very challenging and because of this she promised herself that she would work hard and get out of the poverty situation. That is why she started farming 10 years ago and through farming she has been able to earn a decent income. Ireen is the breadwinner in her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her two children will have a bright future and also her parents will have a comfortable life.

Ireen is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture business.

Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Ireen is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change.

Through the income from horticultural farming, Ireen will assure her children of a bright future and she will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan the promise of supporting small scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 32-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can replace the auto-rickshaw body.
 
She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings by the time her children are getting married. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Seeman's Group

texts.en:
Seeman is a 52-year-old mother of six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years, and up to now his business has been very steady. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts, it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her son is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. 

Therefore, Seeman has requested a loan for her son so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine. 

Seeman hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business, as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools.

loans.name: Yerni

texts.en:
Yerni is a 27-year-old lady, and is married to Niko, a 33-year-old man. They are blessed with two children, namely: Albert, 6, 1st grade of elementary school, and Mira, 4. 

Yerni owns a business selling vegetables, various candies, fried corn, soft drinks, other snacks, etc. She displays those products in a simple shelf while using an old table to put out the vegetables. She initiated the business six month ago by using capital provided by her husband. 

To generate more income, Yerni intends to renew her simple kiosk stock. She hopes the income from this business can help her in covering her children's school fees, and their living expenses as well. 

To help her realizing her dream, Yerni  is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. She plans to spend the loan on various vegetables, fruits, snacks, and ingredients to make cakes.

loans.use: to purchase various vegetables, fruits, snacks, and ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 51 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She says that she will be greatly happy if she manages to have her second Kiva loan for the second time. The first Kiva loan greatly developed her trading business, and this time she hopes that it will be as profitable as the first one.

She still organizes her clothes trading business at the city’s wholesale market at the rented stall, selling both men and women's clothes. During the past 15 years of working in this sphere, she managed to gain a lot of customers who are already her loyal customers; they respect and trust her since she manages to offer them a fashionable and not very expensive assortment of clothes. Mariam always refreshes her stall’s assortment once a month, coming to Yerevan in a rented taxi in order to buy new clothes suited to the season. 

Mariam now lives with her youngest daughter. Her elder daughter is married, and she lives separately. Her husband is temporally out of the Republic. So Mariam works very hard since at the moment, the only source of income for her family is her business.

Mariam asks this loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy winter coats both for women and men since it is of the greatest demand now.

loans.use: to buy winter coats for both women and men, since it is of the greatest demand now

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a fifty-year-old, married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She and her husband have four children aged 24, 22, 18 and 11 years old. 

Marissa operates a store, selling motorcycle spare parts like lubricating oil, helmets, pedals, radiators, clutches, batteries, lighting and filters.  She has been engaged in this kind of  business for almost two years now. 

Marissa  has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy a variety of stocks like mirrors, repair kits, bearings, brakes and cables. With these, Marissa will re-fill her store and be ready to cater for her customers' needs. 

Marissa has  hopes of expanding her business to achieve her dream of sending all her children to college. She also wishes to provide them with proper food and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stocks like mirrors, repair kits, bearings, brakes and cables.

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en:
Sadia is a 35-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running a small printing press for many years. He prints over cardboard boxes for various products on demand. For this purpose he uses various colors of paint, rollers and chemicals.

He belongs to a poor family and is the single responsible person for his children and old parents. His parents remain sick much of the time; he has to spend most of his income upon their care. He wants to grow his business so he can more easily generate additional income than in the past so he can cherish his children and bear the medical expenses of his parents.  

Therefore, Sadia has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy cardboard, paint and chemicals to print more boxes. In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family. He asks for Kiva support and he hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him. 

Sadia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, paint and chemicals to print more boxes.

loans.name: Natividad Teolinda

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 13 De Diciembre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Natividad, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 12 hijos mayores de edad,  7 de sus hijos  aun vive con ellos. Su marido es agricultor.
Doña Natividad con su hijo se dedican al comercio, compran y  venden carne de res o de cerdo, ellos comprar los animales en pie, los faenan y luego llevan la carne a entregar a la ciudad de Guayaquil  ya sea al por mayor o al menudeo, por lo general realizan dos viajes por semana, llevan más de 10 años con este negocio el mismo que les permite salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus actividades en el campo.
Este crédito es para comprar cerdos y reses.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The loan group "Thirteenth of December" meets every two weeks in the Olmedo canton. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and animal raising.

Señora Natividad lives in this place. She is 61 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has 12 adult children. Seven of their children still live with them. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Natividad and her son work in commerce. They buy cattle and pigs and sell meat.  They buy the animals on the hoof. They slaughter them and then they take the meat to deliver to the city of Guayaquil, for either wholesale or retail sales. In general, they make two trips a week. They have been in this business for more than 10 years, and it allows them to get ahead, since her husband doesn't earn much from his work in the fields.

This loan is to buy more pigs and cattle. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offer them. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, aged 39, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who helps her family by providing tailoring services to her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children. This is the reason for her working extremely hard -- to keep her children smiling.
