She started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. She started tailoring work at home and later began sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft, so she would like to buy a sewing machine. Professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

Razia knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives, and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet increasing demand. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single young man from Bethlehem city. He lives with his parents and five brothers and sisters in a simple house. His father works selling furniture in his own store. He also has a carpentry workshop where he makes the furniture. Ahmad started working in the carpentry workshop three years ago and now has a lot of experience.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more wood bars for his carpentry workshop. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase productivity and also his father's store will increase its sales.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more wood bars for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in roofing tiles, window bars, wooden beams, cement, sand and gravel to build a hallway and to install window bars in her home.

loans.name: Donetah

texts.en:
Meet Donetah, who is 34 years old, very hard working, loving, and a mother of one adorable kid. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, which is known to have the best soil for farming and good rainfall patterns. This area is considered good for both crop and animal farming and because of the favorable weather, Donetah has been farming there for the past 5 years. 

Through those years, she has made great strides. She is an enterprising woman who really wants to succeed in life. Being from Africa, a continent with so many challenges, she has to work extra hard. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 62,400 to buy a dairy cow.

Through the loan, Donetah will be able to sell milk to the nearby market and to her neighbors because there is an existing market. She wants to be economically empowered. Knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders support her dreams gives her confidence that her dreams will come true. Through the loan and accumulated profits, Donetah will provide a secure future for her children and will be economically empowered. As people always say, when you empower a woman, you have empowered the whole nation.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Shabani

texts.en:
Shabani, who is in his 30s, is married with one kid who is still small.  He has been running two projects, selling wood and a small butcher shop.  He has had his businesses for five years now. He works from 9 am to 6.30 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Shabani's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start the butcher business and also bought meat for his small butcher shop. He used the profits to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built his house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy wood to resell and beef for his small butcher shop.  He dreams of building another house.

Shabani will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan school.

loans.use: to purchase beef for his small butcher shop and wood to resell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna a 34 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses 5 enfants dans le quartier Wonyomé. Elle commercialise à domicile, au marché et à la criée dans son quartier le manioc et la pate de manioc. Anna est très active. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fermiers 03 fois par mois au marché de Noèpé, une agglomération située à 30 km de la ville de Lomé.
Anna sollicite un prêt pour acquérir 12 sacs de pates de manioc. Les profits lui permettront de concourir aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en: Anna is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and her five children in the Wonyomé neighborhood.  She sells cassava and cassava paste from home, at the market, and also as a street vendor in her own neighborhood.  Anna is very active.  She stocks up from farmers three times per month at the Noèpé market, a town located about 30 km from Lomé.  Anna is taking a loan to buy 12 bags of cassava paste.  With her profits, she will be able to cover some of her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of cassava paste.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
This is Keziah, 23 years old, married and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to gain more skills on enterprise creation and financial management. This has enabled her to manage her enterprise more effectively.

She earns her living by farming vegetables, specifically indigenous kale, spinach and broccoli. She is borrowing to boost her farming by buying fertilizer and manure. She hopes this will improve on her crop yield hence lead to more income. This will enable her to cater for her family's needs with ease.

Keziah is very happy for the great support from Kiva and their lenders.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single man and a Syrian refugee who moved to Lebanon three years ago from Syria, escaping from the war and searching for a safer place for his family. He opened a computer and audio systems shop to ensure an income to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise. He will buy a new collection of computers and audio systems to satisfy his current customers' needs, and attract new ones.

Ali hopes to increase his business further in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of computers and audio systems.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

In 2014, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans. The main hardship she faces is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines, obtain ultrasounds, and pay for medical exams.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is male, 27 years old, and single with no children. Richard sells hardware and has been in that business since 2012. He also practices farming, growing crops such as rice, cotton and maize to sell for a side income. He has a dream of having a modern hardware store for the entire town. However, he is faced with the challenges of high transport costs and market competition. Richard wants money to buy steel plates and round bars to sell.

loans.use: to buy steel plates and round bars to sell.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is a 53-year-old widow from Khashuri district. She has a newly-married son and lives with her daughter-in-law also. The family's only source of income is Nunu's salary; she works as a laborer and generates 300 GEL monthly. As the existing income is hardly enough for a family of three, Nunu decided to start a business for her family's welfare. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or enough income to be sufficient to cover the loan easily, until the Start Up program began. The Start Up program is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows the rural poor, like Nunu, to get a chance for starting or re-starting businesses.

With the requested money she plans to rent a place, purchase all needed merchandise and open a bakery in a good location of town. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a bakery and earn additional income.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 31-year-old married woman from Zugdidi district. She lives with her husband, 2 sons and mother-in-law, who gets an age pension from the local government. 

Lia's husband works hard to lead and take care of his family members. He works in the military and gets a fixed salary. However, his salary is hardly enough for a family of five to be financially stable. 

In spite of her high education, Lia can't find a stable job and has a great desire to do her bit for the family's well-being. So she decided to start baking wedding cakes and sell them locally with private orders.
 
Lia requested a loan to local financial institutions for purchasing all the needed tools and ovens. Her application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start their own businesses. Lia will get the opportunity to generate her own income and help her husband to lead the family effectively.
 
She will be really grateful for being given a chance to be involved in her own business and to create better living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to purchase cake baking tools and open a bakery.

loans.name: Iborooga Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Pauline, pictured with a hand raised, is a member of a village bank where members guarantee each other for a loan. She is a mother of two, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Pauline's business is selling clothes and textiles. In addition to that, she owns a banana plantation where she earns additional income. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations. She aspires to be economically well-off, but educating her children is the sole reason for starting the business.

She needs the loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 41 years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She is married and has four children. For a year, she has been working hard to make a restaurant of her own. 

Cecilia has requested a loan of 300 SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to purchase more food in her restaurant for the customer such as meats, etc .

loans.use: To buy good food to serve in her restaurant

loans.name: Bắc

texts.en:
Mrs. Bắc works in agriculture, farming food.

Bắc is 39 years old and is married with three children. Bắc lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bắc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bắc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bắc faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

Bắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice, who is 51 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management.

Her economic activity is poultry farming. She also owns a kiosk that she plans to expand. For this reason she is borrowing a loan to increase her stock of sugar, salt and tea leaves. This will lead to a larger supply, leading to an increase in her customer base, hence more profits. She also intends to buy more poultry feeds to help improve on her egg production. She hopes both enterprises will flourish, leading to an increase in her income which will in turn help  support her children's education, as she will be able to pay school fees for them. 

Alice is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and increase her stock of sugar, salt and tea leaves.

loans.name: Mpara Church Leaders Group

texts.en:
Stella is a fifty-four-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been in the cattle trade business for eight years. She is also a maize farmer, where she obtains additional income. She experiences transport challenges when taking her cattle to market and her vision is be a leading supplier of cattle in her area. She is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another in a group to get a loan. 

Stella needs the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Agnes, a 39-year-old mother who is very hardworking, ambitious and self-motivated. She lives in the Chuka area of Kenya - a very remote place - but blessed with beautiful weather patterns and climate. This area is very green, making it beautiful and a place you will stay. Agnes is married and has two beautiful children who she always refers to as "her pride” because they are a source of joy to her. That is why she is keen on letting them have a brighter future and a comfortable life. Agnes practices mixed farming - that is, crop and animal farming - and has been doing that for the past 10 years. She has all the farming techniques at her fingertips. Agnes's heart is in dairy farming, as she is passionate about dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows 'Mutune'. There is so much demand for milk in the Chuka area, but the supply is low. To meet the demand, Agnes plans to increase her milk production by buying a dairy cow. She is faced with financial challenges, but knowing that partners such as Juhudi Kilimo (via Kiva) are there, makes her feel relieved and she knows her dreams will be achieved. Agnes expressed that “in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, Agnes is well on her way to achieving this dream. Agnes also wishes to have more consistent income so that she can buy more dairy cows and be self-sufficient.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 42-year old man. He is married to Susanna, a 36-year old woman. They have been blessed with two children. Artin, 11, is a junior high school student. Arjin, 8, is an elementary school student.

Samuel has been renting rooms since the year 2000. He started the kiosk business to improve his income and meet the family's needs. He has seven rented rooms that he wants to renovate, but does not have enough money at hand. He came to TLM and asked for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000.

The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and paint.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for renovation.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Anne. She is married and blessed with four children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from training in group management, savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management. She does vegetable and dairy farming.

She wants a loan to expand her farming business by renting an extra plot of land to enable her to plant more vegetable seedlings. She believes that this will increase her profits and she will be able to support her children by providing quality education.

Anne is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly

loans.use: To pay for an extra plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Nguyên

texts.en:
Nguyên works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 48 years old and married with two children. Nguyên lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nguyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years The main hardship that Nguyên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nguyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tuyến

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyến has a retail business selling stationary items.

Tuyến is 37 years old and she is married with six children. Tuyến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyến has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tuyến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

Tuyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Wandemi  Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Lucy, a member of Wandemi Farmers Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2012. She is a widow and a mother of three children. Two of them are in primary school and one is in secondary school. She is a vegetable farmer and after HiH-EA training she was able to use her entrepreneurial skills to set up a computer training center where she trains her clients.

She is borrowing a loan to purchase one more computer so as to improve on service delivery. She believes that this will further boost her business hence improved income. This will enable her to meet family demands such as school fees with ease.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Thảo has a service business tailoring clothes.

Thảo is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thảo lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thảo first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thảo has been involved in this business for 4 years.
The main hardship that Thảo faces in her life is not having hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet.

loans.name: Karungule Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Aliphose, the person with a hand raised, is a member of a village bank where members guarantee each other for a loan. He is a father of two, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His business is selling furniture. In addition to that, he sells clothes and owns a produce business, where he obtains additional income. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital to buy modern furniture equipment, and his aspiration is to be economically rich. Aliphose needs the loan to buy more timber, with which he will make furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy more timber and build more furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new, large net for fishing, with which he will catch a lot of large fish to sell

loans.name: Cường

texts.en:
Cường works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Cường is 56 years old, and she is married and has two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Cường first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Cường faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick, with which to build a toilet.

Cường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to build a toilet, for her family's use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, and to pay for labor in order to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
This is Phương. She has a service business, shipping goods. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Phương is 37 years old, and she is married and has three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick, with which to build a toilet.

Phương hopes to maintain a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to build a toilet

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hoa is 59 years old, and she is married and has two children, but no dependents. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick, with which to build a toilet.

Hoa hopes to maintain a successful business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, with which to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles.

She is 30 years old and married with one child. Hà lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Trà

texts.en:
Trà works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for six years. Trà is 40 years old, and he is married and has two children. He lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is the first loan for Trà with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a biogas system. He is requesting a loan to purchase equipment with which to build a biogas system.

With his business profit, Trà hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment that he will use to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris is a 43-year old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer raising animals and growing food crops like matooke and maize. He faces the challenges of unstable prices; however, he hopes to have enough family income and educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Chris needs a loan to buy exotic cattle for raising.

loans.use: to buy exotic cattle to raise.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Hiền has been involved in this business for five years. Hiền is 25 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans.

Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having an hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a toilet.

loans.name: Tình

texts.en:
Mr. Tình works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

He is 35 years old and married with two children. He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Tình has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. He has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Tình faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, he hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Huyền

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền has a service business tailoring clothes.

She is 36 years old and married with two children. Huyền lives with two dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huyền has been involved in this business for seven years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Yến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Yến is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Đần

texts.en:
Mrs. Đần works in agriculture, in particular marine aquaculture. Đần has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Đần is 57 years old and she is married with four children. Đần lives with no dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đần's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Đần faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Đần hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dục

texts.en:
Dục works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Dục is 44 years old, and she is married and has two children. Dục lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Dục joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Dục faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick, with which to build a two-hole latrine.

With her business profit, Dục hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to build a two-hole latrine.

loans.name: Ngangi Byansi Group

texts.en: Patrick is a thirty-two-year-old, married man with five children. He owns a maize store in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is also in farming, growing Irish potatoes and beans for many years. His hardship is that the business is seasonal. His vision is to become a market leader of the maize business, plus to own a good food store that caters for increased demand during periods of no production, as dry seasons are hurting farmers seriously. Patrick needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is 39 years old, married with four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Teddy is in the poultry-keeping business and also grows crops such as maize, bananas, beans and others to increase her income. She has a dream of expanding her poultry business. However, she is faced with a challenge of floods and inadequate capital. Teddy wants money to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana,  tiene 57 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 15 años el mismo que estudia en colegio.
Doña Ana tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende  todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, pescado, helados y  otros productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, su nieto le ayuda cuando está desocupado, pero es ella la que pasa el más tiempo en su tienda ya que allí se gana la vida y también está al tanto de todo lo que la rodea. Lleva más de 23 años con su negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, carnes, pescado y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 13 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para ayudar a sus hijos. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "3 de Mayo" meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being an area with a lot of commerce.  Here they have traditional festivals for patron saints San Pedro and San Pablo, and the people are known to be very cheerful.

This is where Ana, 57, lives.  She is separated, and has 3 grown children from a prior relationship who are already independent.  A 15 year-old grandson who is in school lives with her.  

Ana has a grocery store in her home where she sells all types of products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, vegetables, meats, fish, ice cream, and other consumer staples.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm, and sometimes even later.  Her grandson helps her when he has free time, but she is the one who spends the most time in her store, because this is where she earns a living and also keeps up with everything that is going on around her.  She has had this business for more than 23 years.

Ana will use this loan to stock her store with rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, meats, fish, and other consumer staples.  She's been with her communal bank for 13 years, and she likes it because of the loans that have enabled her to help her children.  Her goal is to continue forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Marvih

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Marvih is a married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She engages in the buying and selling of umbrellas, pocketbooks, sandals and ready-to-wear clothing like pants, T-shirts, blouses and ladies' jeans. 

She is a mother of five children. The oldest is 20, while the youngest is 7. 

Marvih has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy assorted stock like men's and women's wear, and additional stock like ham, sausages and hot dogs. With these items, Marvih could offer her customers a wide array of stock and possibly increase her earnings, thus, providing her children with proper diets and good living conditions.

Marvih would like to expand her business, as that would help support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock like men's and women's wear, and additional stock like ham, sausages and hot dogs

loans.name: Ntamil

texts.en:
Ntamil, 38 years old, is a female who is married with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman whose main business is selling clothes for children, men and women. She has been in this business for six years and has benefited a lot from it. She started this business to raise income for family support and hopes to grow her business into a wholesale shop.

Ntamil wants the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Angels Group

texts.en:
Elena is the featured borrower of Angels Group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Elena is a 56-year-old married mother of four children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions; thus, she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing living costs in the Philippines.
 
The same case is applied on the other group members. April is a 25-year-old married mother of one child, and Mary is a 36-year-old married lady of two children. They both want to support their families in the Philippines.

Elena is the first lady on the left; April is the first lady on the right of the photo; and Mary is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing living costs

loans.name: Krobor Bukum Group

texts.en:
Christiana, who is 53, is married. All her children are grown and taking care of themselves. Christiana has been selling scarves and cosmetics for 24 years. This business enables her to increase her income. Christiana starts her business at 7:00 a.m. and closes at 5:00 p.m. daily. She is able to make a good profit each month. 

Christiana is requesting her seventh loan from ID-Ghana. She will use this loan to buy more scarves and cosmetics to resell to customers. Christiana thanks Kiva lenders for their willingness to support her with improving the group's businesses. 

She managed to earn a profit, which she used to cover household expenses and expansion of her business. She dreams that one day, she will be able to expand her business to other areas and to increase her income. 

Christiana will share this total loan amount of GHS 3,600 with her group members, which total four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more scarves and cosmetics to resell to customers.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, 32 years old, is a married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a restaurant, which is his major business, but he also earn more income from his motorcycle, which is used for transport in Bundibugyo town. He is a hard-working man, and he has managed to look after his family well using the the proceeds from his business. He is affected by limited capital. He hopes to complete his house.

Rashid wants a loan to buy utensils for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy utentils for his restaurant

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a hard-working woman dedicated to her own business. She is married and has four children. She is a farmer and has been raising onions, maize and tomatoes for the last five years. She chose this business because it is profitable and her fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables. Zaynab sells her vegetables in the local market. Her husband actively helps her to raise the vegetables.

As her products are in high demand, Zaynab wants to expand her business and produce more vegetables. For this purpose, she applied for a 10,000 TJS loan to buy new seeds and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel for the new sowing season

loans.name: Oysanam

texts.en: Oysanam is a successful woman. She is married and has three adult children. She always tries to offer good living conditions to her children. Today, Oysanam’s business consists of two dairy cows and some sheep. She also grows cattle feed. Oysanam's monthly income is small and it is not enough to provide her family with all the necessary things. She must buy coal for the winter season in order to keep her house warm. Oysanam is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy coal. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy coal for the winter season.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. She started working seven years ago as a Tupperware saleswoman to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Nadine is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new Tupperware collection to satisfy her customers and to attract new ones. Nadine hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own Tupperware shop, which would increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new Tupperware collection

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Khanyounis. He lives with his mother in a small, simple house. His mother works as an employee in a local firm where she earns a low income. Mohammad opened a store to sell computer and mobile accessories four years ago. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell in his accessories store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in his accessories store

loans.name: Nandighosha Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of 15 members from a small rural village called Bissam Cuttack in the district of Rayagada in Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the front line on the right side raising her hand in the photo is one of the members named Babita. She is 39 years old, living with her husband and one daughter. Babita hails from a very poor, landless, illiterate, Below Poverty Line category. She is running a Hotel (restaurant) with the support of her husband. In a month, her family earns about Rs.5,500 INR, which is not sufficient to manage her family. So Babita wants to increase her income by adding some extra income by expanding her Hotel. She wants to have enough stock to support her business to run for long days. Babita wants to use the present loan for purchasing four sets of dining tables and chairs as well as enough stock of wheat, sugar, oil and other food items necessary for the hotel business.

Babita wants to complete her half-constructed house in the near future using the surplus of her business. The other 14 members of her group are doing a cloth business, leaf plate business, diary, grocery shop, Tiffin stall and vegetable vending business.

loans.use: to purchase four sets of dinning tables and chairs as well as enough stock of wheat, sugar, oil and other food items necessary for the hotel (restaurant) business.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira sews wonderful national Tajik women's dresses. She is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has four children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. They must comfort their children with all the modern conveniences. She tries to provide them with a better quality of life. That’s why four years ago, she began her own business by sewing national women's dresses. She has additional income from growing vegetables. Munira is going to sow vegetables in the new season but she has not enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Davlathonim

texts.en: Davlathonim was born in 1972. She is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking woman. Davlathonim has been busy sewing more than 20 years. She sews a variety of national women's dresses. Thanks to her high quality service, she has regular customers. Davlathonim has her own workshop where she services her clients. Davlathonim must buy a heater to keep her workshop warm in the winter season. In this way, she will offer a high quality service to her clients. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a heater. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a heater for her workshop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 31 years old. She sells cooking utensils, bags and slippers, which she sells to her customers. This is her eighth loan with the institution, and Evelyn is going to use it to purchase GHS 1,500 worth of utensils, bags and slippers. She operates her business from a container which is located at the roadside. This location allows her to be exposed to a wide range of customers and relate well to them. Evelyn is growing her business; therefore she thought it wise to approach ID-Ghana for financial assistance. She is going to use the profits to continue buying merchandise, and this way increase her working capital and be able to keep herself well. She is happy and grateful for this opportunity that she is being offered.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils, bags and slippers, which she sells to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, and paint in order to renovate her house

loans.name: Mahmadyusuf

texts.en: Mahmadyusuf was born in 1964. He is married and has three children. His children are adults. Mahmadyusuf worked for the last two years in a primary company. He is a very hardworking man and does his job well. Mahmadyusuf always tries to offer his children a high quality education. His son is a student. Mahmadyusuf must pay for his tuition but he does not have enough savings, because he uses his salary to buy food items for his family. He is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition of his son. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for his son

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 47 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child who is now school age. 

Letecia has been engaged in an agribusiness activity, specifically coconut production, for 10 years already. She has also been engaged in managing a little sari-sari store for one year. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in acquiring a parcel of pawned coconut land in the area. 

Letecia has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Letecia hopes to expand her sari-sari store and coconut production business.

loans.use: To acquire a parcel of pawned coconut land

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik is from Armavir town, where she currently lives with her daughter-in-law and grandchild. Satenik's son is a migrant worker in neighbouring country, trying to support his family financially. Her daughter-in-law works at a local school as a teacher, and Satenik takes care of the household, farm and her small grandchild.

On the farm she keeps livestock (pigs, piglets, hens and 7 colonies of bees); cultivates onion, pepper, and pumpkin; and grows a wide range of fruit trees (peach, apricot and cherry). Satenik now needs some funds to invest in her farm and develop it. Specifically, she asks for a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer, trestle for the greenhouse and hire workers to help with the cultivation work. 

Satenik needs this loan, as it is very difficult for her organize all the work alone. She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fertilizer, trestle for the greenhouse and hire workers.

loans.name: Jhanshirani Group

texts.en:
Manika, the lady standing first from the right in the front row with her hand raised in the photo, is a very active woman of 34 years of age. She resides with her family in the village named Hatamuniguda in Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Manika hails from a very poor family of the Below Poverty Line category. She is living with her husband, one son and two daughters. All her children are going to school. 

Manika has been running a laundry shop with the support of her husband in a wooden cabin in her small village for the last six years. She started the business with a small investment of her own. Presently, she is earning a monthly income of 5,000 INR. As per the statement of Manika. this small income is not at all sufficient to manage the family along with the educational expenses of her children.  So she wants to increase her income by expanding her existing business. She motivated other women members of her village and formed a Group of nine women for a new loan. With the present loan, she will purchase a good quality washing machine, an iron and a table. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income and make savings. She will be able to construct a house for her family as well as a permanent cabin for her business. The other eight members of the group do businesses like a grocery shop, vegetable vending, leaf plate business, two/three wheeler spare parts business, mobile repair center and a laundry.

loans.use: to purchase a good quality washing machine, an iron and a table

loans.name: María Marisel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, el mayor  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz. 
Doña María tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual venden  todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, ella también vende ropa de todo tipo, bisuterías y artículos para el hogar, lo cual vende en su local y también puerta a puerta ya que sale dos veces por semana a visitar a sus clientes, sus hijos y su marido le ayudan en su negocio más en los días que ella sale. Lleva más de 14 años con su tienda la cual le sirve de mucho ya que así se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda, ropa y  artículos para el hogar. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 10 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast day of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

This is where María, 46, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 10, who both attend school.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.

María has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents.  She also sells all types of clothing, jewelry and home products.  She sells these door-to-door twice a week.  Her children and husband help with the business when she goes out.  For over 14 years she has been earning a living for her family through her store.

This loan will be used to buy groceries for her store, clothing and home products.  María has been a member of the group for 10 years and claims the loans help her business.  Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries, clothing and household products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old living in town. Her mother died one year ago. Mary has been working in the market and she tries to cook some food to help with school fees.
 
Mary has requested a loan of 600 SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to purchase more posho, cassava flour and beans, and will help Marry to generate a greater profit.

loans.use: To buy food like posho, cassava flour and beans for her customers

loans.name: Saishakti Group

texts.en:
A women's group of nine members called Saishakti is located in Bissam Cuttack village in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Ramadevi is one of the members of this group. The lady standing third from left with her hand raised is Ramadevi. She is a very active young lady of 36 years of age. She lives with her husband and one daughter who is 14 years of age.

Ramadevi, along with her husband, is doing a dry food (pampad) business. Pampad is normally eaten as snacks as well as with lunch in this part of Odisha. There are various types of pampad. Ramadevi always prepares good quality pampad and, hence, the demand for it is high in her locality. As it is a homemade item, two other women are also employed in this activity and the business is running well. The family income of Ramadevi is about 6,500 INR per month. On the other hand, the monthly family expenses of Ramadevi is the same. As a result, her savings or investment is almost nil. 

Ramadevi wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will use the present loan to buy in a bulk a stock of green grams, Bengal grams, lentils and black grams. As it is the harvest season for those items, Ramadevi wants to keep a good quantity of stock for the long run of the business. She expects a good return from her business by expanding it. Ramadevi dreams of being a wholesaler of pampad in her locality. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.
 
The other eight members of this group are involved in businesses like vegetable vending, grocery shop, leaf plate business, laundry and paddy businesses.

loans.use: to buy in bulk green grams, Bengal grams, lentils and black grams

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Sobeida es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de diez, siete y cuatro años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de fruta.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, fuerte, luchadora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola entre productores campesinos y comerciantes mayoristas que se ocupan de distribuir los productos en los diferentes mercados, de clima cálido, húmedo y tropical, con una temperatura que ronda los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Sobeida es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo, estatura alta, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (al centro, blusa celeste con rayas horizontales blanca y negra). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como chofer de taxi, y sus tres hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. Su necesidad por mejorar los ingresos de su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras y venta de helado, para solicitar un préstamo y aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
Su negocio es la venta de fruta como la; mandarina, naranja, lima, toronja y limón, que son las que se producen en el lugar. Por las mañanas acompañada en el taxi de su esposo, se dirigen a repartir la fruta a diferentes clientes constantes como, tiendas de barrio, jugueras, restaurantes, etc, por la tarde carga su carrito de dos ruedas y se pasea por ciertos lugares comerciales vendiendo por menor y a detalle. La fruta es muy consumida por la mayoría de la población haciendo de su actividad un negocio rentable. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, y desea realizar la compra de fruta por mayor para abastecer y sobre stockear a sus clientes para no perder ventas de fin de año. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sobeida solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta por mayor y sobre stockear a sus clientes para no perder ventas en fin de año.
texts.en:
Sobeida, 29, lives with her partner and has three children, ages ten, seven and four.  Her business is selling fruit.  She is a good mother: patient, strong, determined and hard-working.  She runs her business in "El Torno", a rural area known for its agricultural commerce between farm producers and wholesale merchants who distribute products in different markets.  The climate here is warm, humid and tropical with a temperature of around 30 degrees Celsius all year long.

Sobeida has a dark complexion, long black hair, is tall and has a robust physique.  Her native tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish.  (she's in the middle wearing a blue top with black and white stripes).  Her husband is a taxi driver and her two eldest children attend school.  The youngest one is in her care.  Her desire to improve her business is what encouraged her to form a communal bank with people in businesses such as cell phone sales, coca leaf sales, quinoa juice sales, perfume sales, soft drink sales, regional costume sales, and ice cream sales.  The loan she is requesting is to take advantage of the year-end sales season.

Her business is selling fruit such as tangerines, oranges, limes, grapefruit and lemons which are all produced locally.  In the morning she goes out with her husband in the taxi and they go to her fixed customers, including neighborhood stores, juice shops, restaurants, etc.  In the afternoon she goes out with her two-wheel cart selling in commercial areas.  Her business is very profitable because of the popularity of the fruit.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.  She wants to buy fruit wholesale and stock up for year-end sales.  This is her second loan through the institution since starting her business two years ago.

Sobeida is requesting the loan to buy fruit wholesale and stockpile for her customers so as not to lose year-end sales.

loans.use: To buy fruit wholesale to stockpile for year-end sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pigs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy home appliances.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is from Githunguri, Kenya. His main business is keeping dairy cows. He has 8 full grown cows and every day he takes the milk to his dairy cooperative to be processed into milk and yogurt which is sold all over Kenya. He is a successful business man with his dairy farm, but fuel is so expensive in Kenya that he can only buy a little bit of lpg (liquid petroleum gas) for cooking every month. His family still has to cook most of their foods with firewood and charcoal which causes lung problems and stings the eyes. And even though they use these cheaper fuels, they still spend more than KES 4,500 (USD 50) every single month just for cooking fuel! 

When Daniel was a child, he remembers playing in the trees. Now there are very few trees in his village for the children to play in since they are being cut down for firewood. Daniel's neighbor got a biogas system and Daniel saw how simple it was to use! You just fill it with cow dung and cook with the biogas like it is lpg, but cheap!! Please help Daniel to get a loan so that he can also have a biogas system. With the biogas system, his family will be healthy and his cows will be even more important since they will provide the family with clean cooking energy.

Daniel is most proud of his family's good hospitality. When people come to visit them, they know they will be well fed. When his wife can cook over biogas the family can provide even better hospitality to their neighbors. Asante! (Thank you in Swahili)

loans.use: To buy a biogas system to have clean cooking fuel

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in a small village called Gatitu about two hours drive from Nairobi. She has a farm with her family where she keeps 3 dairy cows, 15 chickens and grows crops for the consumption of her family. Nearly everything she needs is right on her farm. She even has a borehole that she can collect clean drinking water from whenever she needs it. 

The one thing she lacks is fuel for cooking. She spends KES 5,000 (USD 55) or more every month to buy cooking fuel for her family. She uses firewood, charcoal and sawdust for cooking. Firewood and charcoal take a long time to light and when they burn they fill her lungs with smoke and make her children cough. 

Lucy learned about biogas from Takamoto Biogas at a presentation in her village, and many of her neighbors are already using biogas. She needs this loan to get a biogas system. With a biogas system she will only use the waste of her cows to produce energy and she will save money every month. Biogas is also important to Lucy because she is worried about the health of her children and biogas doesn't produce any smoke. Please help Lucy take care of her family by getting a biogas system. Asante (thank you in Swahili)

loans.use: To purchase a biogas system for clean cooking

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TALO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des poissons, des céréales et des condiments.
 Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA  sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. BINTOU, 2ème femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  100kgs de poissons frais avec les pécheurs, une partie serait séchée et l’autre vendue au frais. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group have an average age of 36 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in extended traditional families in Talo/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are relatives and are retailers of fish, cereals, and condiments. The women of the Djiguiya group are on their first group loan.

Bintou, sitting second from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of fresh fish from the fishermen. Part of the fish will be dried and part will be sold fresh. She gets her supplies locally and from the surrounding villages. She makes her sales to a clientele made up of women and men for cash and often credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, some of which will be spent on health care, food, clothing, and education, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Gloria tiene 44 años, vive junto a sus tres hijos, ya que hace algún tiempo atrás su esposo la dejó abandonada. Gloria por las mañanas trabaja en un restaurante ayudando a cocinar, tiene mucha experiencia en esta rama. A partir de las cuatro de la tarde ella recorre vendiendo cosméticos, visita a todos sus clientes del sector; Gloria hace todo lo posible por sacar adelante a sus hijos, le ha tocado trabajar muy duro durante todo este tiempo.
Gloria con el crédito de Fundación Alternativa y del proyecto Kiva  podrá comprar más cosméticos para su negocio, ya que quiere incrementar sus ventas porque estamos en un mes muy bueno para el comercio; se siente muy agradecida con la Institución y con Kiva porque con este dinero ella podrá crecer en su negocio y a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city on the coast with an agreeable climate. It's a very commercial city since it serves as a port and links the coast with the mountains. Gloria is 44 years old and lives alone with her three children after her husband abandoned her some time ago. She works in a restaurant in the mornings helping to cook since she's very experienced in this area.  After 4PM she sells cosmetics and travels throughout her neighborhood visiting all her clients. Gloria does everything she can to help her children move forward and she's had to work very hard through all this time.
With the loan from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, Gloria will buy more cosmetics for her business because she wants to increase her sales this month since it's a good one for business in general. She's very grateful to the institution and Kiva because with this loan she'll be able to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics to restock her business and helps with her children's education and give a better future to her kids.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une veuve de 69 ans. Elle élève seule ses 04 enfants. Ils vivent dans le quartier Avenou. Elle commercialise les boules « d’Akassan », transformation d’une pate fermentée faite à base de maïs.Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Adidogomé et s’y rend 03 fois par mois.Akossiwa souhaite augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses produits par l’achat de 30 bols de maïs et 10 sachets de poissons frits.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 69-year-old widow. She is raising her 4 children alone. They live in the district of Avenou. She sells "Akassan balls," made from fermented, maize-based paste. She gets her supplies as the Adidogomé market, where she goes three times a month. Akossiwa would like to increase her income and diversify her product range by buying 30 bowls of maize and 10 bags of fried fish.

loans.use: to buy 30 bowls of maize and 10 bags of fish.

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Mme SALI est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Il a 19ans et va à l'école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des jus et de l'eau glacée depuis 10ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s'acheter 02sacs de sucre, 01sac de bissaps et 02paquets de sachet pour le conditionnement du jus.
Mme veut améliorer son activité et pouvoir s'acheter une parcelle avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne aider à la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Sali is married and the mother of a child. He is 19 years old and goes to school. She is also responsible for three more people. She has been selling juice and ice water for 10 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. She would like to buy 2 bags of sugar, 1 bag of hibiscus and 2 lots of plastic bags in which to package the juice. She would like to improve her business and to be able to buy a plot of land with her profits. She aims to support her child with his education.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar, 1 bag of hibiscus and 2 lots of plastic bags in which to package the juice.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam estudió Belleza y estética en una academia y se dedicó al mejoramiento de la imagen de sus clientes; por un largo tiempo, la peluquería, su mayor fortaleza, le ayudó a conseguir clientes, que le compraran productos traidos desde Estados Unidos; hoy su enfoque principal es la comercialización de mercancia variada, como ropa, accesorios entre otros articulos,que esten de acuerdo con  la temporada, la que actualmente es fin de año, epoca de muchas festividades y celebraciones familiares, que hacen que sus ventas tradicionalmente se incrementen, impactando positivamente la generación de ingresos. Miriam trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche, vendiendo a crédito, desde los lunes a los domingos, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida  de su familia, aunque su mayor desafio sea obtener fuentes de financiación, lo cual está logrando con este crédito, al cual está aplicando, que es  el primero que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará ropa exterior elegante, calzado, accesorios fantasias etc. todo con el fin de que su clientela esté elegantemente vestida. en las fiestas mas lindas del año "Las Navidades, despedida del año viejo y bienvenida del año nuevo 2015.
texts.en:
Miriam studied beauty and aesthetics in an academy and she worked improving the image of her clients. Hair dressing, which is her strong suit, helped her for a long time to get clients that would buy her products brought from the United States. Her main focus now is selling diverse seasonal merchandise like clothes and accessories. Because it's the end of the year there are many festivities and family celebrations which make her sales increase having a positive impact on her income.  
Miriam works from 8AM to 8PM, seven days a week, and sells her merchandise on credit with the goal of improving the quality of life of her family. Her biggest challenge is obtaining financing resources which she's accomplishing with this loan she's requesting.  This is the first loan she's requested to  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with it she will buy elegant dresses, shoes and accessories among other items so that her clientele is elegantly dressed during the most beautiful celebrations of the year, Christmas and New Years.

loans.use: comprará ropa exterior elegante, calzado, accesorios fantasias etc

loans.name: El Llanito Group

texts.es:
“El Llanito” es un grupo conformado por 8 integrantes es un grupo muy unido pero sobre todo muy responsables aunque ya hay personas de la tercera edad esto no es impedimento para que continúen con sus negocios.

El nombre del grupo hace referencia al lugar donde vive la representante, punto de reunión de los integrantes para hacer sus pagos, donde hay un llanito "Todos los días estaba lleno de animales y de mujeres que cuidaban a sus pequeños mientras ellos jugaban fútbol". 

Doña Victoria tiene 62 años de edad y es madre de un hijo que ya es mayor de edad. Su esposo, Don Alejandro trabaja en el campo mientras que Victoria se dedica a la cría de borregos y pavos para venderlos. hace 40 años, cuando ella inició su actividad, criaba borregos y no gastaba en alimento: aprovechaba los campos verdes de los alrededores para sacar a pastar a sus animales. Con el tiempo más personas de la misma comunidad iniciaron con la misma actividad y fue así que también comenzó a criar pavos. Victoria necesita invertir para continuar con su actividad, por lo que solicitó un préstamo a VisionFund para comprar pavos y alimento. “Estos animales me ayudan mucho porque cuando en el pueblo hay alguna festividad la mayoría de las personas me compran los pavos”. En la comunidad se acostumbra preparar un platillo con la carne de animal y mole verde o rojo. 

Aunque también en algunas ocasiones sus animales suelen enfermar e incluso morir, lo cual representa un pérdida de ganancia e inversión. Doña Victoria no se desanima, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable pero sobretodo muy alegre. Sonriendo comento “En esta vida el sol sale para todos” lo comentó después de hablar de toda la competencia que tiene en la comunidad y con la esperanza de que con el apoyo económico y su esfuerzo, seguirá viendo frutos. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Modesta y Esther invertirán pollos; Florencio y Celia, en becerros mientras que José, Sandra y Guadalupe lo harán en borregos. Todos ellos están muy contentos porque podrán ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
“El Llanito” is a close-knit and responsible group composed of 8 members, including some senior citizens who continue to manage their businesses despite their age without any problem. 

The name of the group makes reference to the place where the group's representative lives and where they meet to make their payments and there is a "llanito" (plain). "Everyday it was full of animals and women taking care of the children while they played soccer.

Doña Victoria is 62 years old and has an adult son. Her husband, Don Alejandro, works the fields while Victoria raises sheep and turkeys for sale. Forty years ago, when she started her business she didn't have to spend on feed because her animals could graze on the green fields surrounding her house. Over time more people in her community started doing the same and that's how she also started to raise turkeys.  
Victoria needs to invest some money in order to continue her business and that's why she has requested a loan to VisionFund to buy turkeys and feed. "These animals help me a lot because whenever there is a celebration in town most people buy my turkeys." In the community there is a typical dish with turkey and red or green "mole". 
Although sometimes her animals also get sick or even die, which represents a loss of investment and income, Doña Victoria is never discouraged. She's a hard working and responsible woman, but most of all, very happy.  "In this life the sun shines for everyone" she commented after explaining all the competition she faces within the community. She's hopeful that with the economic help and her hard work her business will bear fruits. 
The rest of the members of the group are Modesta and Esther who will invest in chickens; Florencio and Celia, in calves while José, Sandra and Guadalupe will do so in sheep. All of them are very happy to be improving the quality of life of their families.

loans.use: buy turkeys and feed.

location.town: Ejido de palmillas San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Margarita Agustina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 73 años de edad, hace varios años quedo viuda pero de esa relación tuvo nueve hijos mayores de edad, seis de ellos aun viven con  ella.
Doña Margarita se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo recorriendo la localidad. Parte del crédito ella se lo da a uno de sus hijos  que vive con ella, el se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y frutas en el mercado de Tarqui en  Manta. Ella trabaja dos o tres días por semana, mientras que su hijo casi todos los días. A ella le encanta salir a realizar sus ventas ya que así se gana algo y se entretiene realizando sus ventas.  
Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa, frutas y legumbres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 10 años y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos. Su sueño es seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito 3 de Mayo meets every 15 days at the church Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The area is a well known commercial zone and is also known for its festivals of Saint Peter and Saint Paul as well as its jovial people.
It is here that lives Margarita who is 73 years old.  She was widowed some years ago but she had nine children from that relationship, all of them adults now but six of them still live with her.
Doña Margarita sells clothes of all types throughout the neighborhood. She will give part of the loan to one of the sons that lives with her who sells vegetables, legumes, and fruits at the market of Tarqui in Manta. She works 2-3 days per week but her son works almost everyday. She likes to go out to make her sales because she earns some extra money and entertains herself.  
She will use this new loan to buy clothes, vegetables, and fruits. She's been in the Grupo De Crédito for 10 years and she likes it because they've always helped her with the loans. Her dream is to keep moving forward and having good health.

loans.use: buy clothes, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish remodeling her house since it has some problems with the roof and some furniture that need to be repaired.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 32-year-old man married to Naomi, who adds additional income to support their family; they are blessed with two children.  Patrick has been operating a leather embroidery bags shop business for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Patrick is now servicing his second loan of KES. 30,000, and intends to use this amount to buy thread, beads, glue sticks, and leathers.  

He plans to use the anticipated income to open a boutique business shop and pay school fees for his children. He hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy thread, beads, glue sticks, and leathers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used the previous loan to buy tomatoes to plant. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Agnes is a farmer but also has a retail shop to supplement her farming activities since farming is seasonal with unpredictable outputs. Her major business challenges include inadequate capital and price fluctuations. 

Agnes is requesting a loan to improve her banana plantation as she desires to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: to improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock so that she can have income when the time comes to sell the animals.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Daisy, a very hardworking, honest and ever-smiling mother of five lovely children that she really treasures. She is 43 years of age, and has been practicing farming for the past eight years. She is one of the hardworking women in her village, and she offers free advice to young farmers and extends extension services to other farmers in neighboring villages. 

Daisy's primary source of income is milk and egg selling, and through these, she has been able to earn an honest income. Daisy hails from the Litein area of Kenya, a place blessed with “Mother Nature”, and good conditions that favor agricultural activities. Daisy is a very aspiring woman who wants to protect the future of her children and grandchildren. Hence, she is putting extra efforts into farming so that she can make ends meet. 

Daisy is seeking funds to build a greenhouse on her piece of land; with the greenhouse, her crops will have controlled environmental conditions that are ideal for crops to grow healthy. With the greenhouse, Daisy will increase her supply of tomatoes and she will be assured of more income. 

Being a mother in Africa is very challenging, and accessing funds is so hard, but with institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Daisy is assured of realizing her dream. Daisy has undergone training on how to save the income generated from the greenhouse, and she is much disciplined with finances. 

She is sure that through the loan, she will have permanent life change. Profits from the greenhouse will allow Daisy to improve her living conditions and assure her grandchildren of a good and secure future.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Santos Eugenia

texts.es:
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar pollo de engorde y gallinas ponedoras, ya que cuenta con las instalaciones necesarias para montar una granja avícola, también quiere mejorar las instalaciones de su granja de cerdos. 

Las proyecciones de santos son dar estudio a sus hijos, ya que uno quiere ser médico veterinario, comprar ganado lechero para vender leche y sus derivados y comprar el vehículo para trasladar el alimento de los animales.
texts.en:
The loan will be used to buy broiler chickens and egg laying hens. She has the necessary facilities to start a poultry farm. She also wants to improve the facilities in her pig farm. 
 
Santos's goals are to give her children an education. One of them wants to be a veterinarian. She also wants to buy dairy cattle to sell milk and dairy products and buy a vehicle to transport the animal feed.

loans.use: to buy broiler chicken and egg laying hens as well as to improve the facilities of her pig farm.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Gayane, from Noyakert village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband, daughter, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

Gayane and her family members are involved in agriculture. The farm which they own includes livestock of cow, calves, and hens, and also arable land where they grow wheat, watermelon, peaches, apricots, cherries, plums and apples. 

The gathered harvest is sold in local markets so the family is able to earn income for living. 

To be able to develop their farm, and invest on it some funds, Gayane has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase seeds, forage for feeding the livestock, and to hire workers for land cultivation. 

Gayane and her whole family hope for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, forage for feeding the livestock, and hire to workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron steels, and gravel to expand his house

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh, 44 years old, is a married man and a father of one child, living with his family in Haja, Yemen. He has a university education. 

Saleh is the sole breadwinner of the family. The house where he lives with his family lacks many home appliances and furniture and what they do have is very old.
