Hemalata hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested. She hopes to give better education to her children.

The other twelve members of the group are also doing small enterprises like general grocery shop, vegetable cultivation and vending, and cotton cultivation. They are very much happy to be associated with Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, shampoo, chocolate,  etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Ulither

texts.en:
With her first loan from Kiva, Ulither has been doing very well in her clothing business. She was able to buy a variety of clothes, increase sales, and expand the business. She used the profits from selling clothing to start a poultry business that has been operating for the past three months. These businesses are enabling Ulither to increase her family’s income and standard of living. 

She is very thankful for those who have supported her growing business.

Having repaid her Kiva loan, Ulither now hopes to get another loan to help expand the clothing business into a busy market. She wants to complete her house, which is now at window level, and to save money to further her education.

loans.use: to expand the clothing business.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en: Soy is 52 years old and a mother of six children who are living in Kampong Speu province. She can earn income via rice cropping to support her family's conditions. She earns about 15,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of six members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can have clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sibongile

texts.en:
Sibongile has been able to purchase a fence, fertilizer, and seeds for her business using the first loan. Along with growing potatoes, she has also diversified into buying and selling beer. With the Kiva loan, she also managed to open a pre-school, which has 29 students. With the profits from her business, she is now able to buy food, medication, and clothing for her family. 

Sibongile also assists her young sister with school fees. She is now financial independent; she can make decisions on how to use her money. She has faced challenges with her parents, who are failing to settle their debts for school fees and sometimes end up using her money to pay the teacher. Sibongile’s family members and husband are very supportive of her business. She is the breadwinner of the family, taking care of four people. With the nature of her business in her community, she has a lot of customers. 

She hopes to buy a commercial stand with the loan, so that she can formalize her business of liquor selling.

loans.use: to buy a stand to expand her liquor business

loans.name: Sreydam's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Preah Vihear province, Sreydam is 40 years old and the mother of three children; one is too young and two are in school. To support her family, she works for others for a fee and raises chickens and pigs as the main source of income. Now, she can earn up to 25,500 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Sreydam with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes to earn more income better than before.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Nhóm 03, Minh Hùng, Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hóa is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Hóa works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future. Hóa has been involved in this business for 4 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hóa is the group leader of the 03 Minh Hùng, Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2012, Hóa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hóa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Srey Peou

texts.en:
Srey Peou, 25 years old, lives with her parents in Phnom Penh City. She is a university student who is majoring in Pharmacy. She is facing financial issues because the financial support that she gets from her family is enough to pay only for her daily expenses. Now she is lacking money to pay for her tuition. 

Therefore, this near future pharmacist is applying for a loan from Kiva to pay for her tuition fees. She promises that she will repay the loan with the interest punctually, based on the repayment schedule. She is honestly thankful for this Kiva loan which provides her with much lower interest than a normal loan. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, she would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she can already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Josefina wants to have an extension of her store so she could operate a computer shop business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a hard-working father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is engaged in reselling fish and frozen foods within the local community to generate additional income. 

Due to the hardships of life, he aims to improve his business and make it profitable in order to satisfy the necessities of his family. Having insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP10,000 to buy more fish and frozen foods to resell. Through this financial assistance, Manuel believes that someday, he will further improve his business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more fish and frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, vive en compañía de sus padres, hermanos, hijos y su compañero de vida; por necesidad de tener ingresos con los que colaboraría en los gastos familiares hace un tiempo instalo en su vivienda una pequeña venta de boquitas, con la buena administración actualmente ya cuenta con una tienda bien establecida de productos varios.
Solicita ayuda para comprar productos enlatados, bebidas, granos básicos, harina, pan, aceite, especias y otros productos para mejorar las ofertas, espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, tener mejores ventas e ingresos.
Sus proyectos son cancelar sus deudas y ampliar su negocio, para tener recursos económicos con los que su familia tenga mejor vida.
texts.en: María lives with her parents, siblings, children and her life partner. Some time ago, she established a small snacks store in her house to help pay for household expenditures. Due to good management, she now has an established business with a variety of products. María is requesting assistance to purchase canned goods, drinks, basic grains, flour, bread, oil, spices and other products to improve her business offerings. She hopes to meet her customers' needs and improve her sales and profits. Her projects include paying off her debts and growing her business in order to have the financial resources necessary to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, basic grains, flour, bread, oil, spices and other products in order to improve her business offerings.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 38 years old and five of her children are in school.

Jocelyn has a sewing business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for six years. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials to use in her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use in her business

loans.name: Yesu Nti Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yesu Nti (for Christ sake). It consists of five members who live in the same area in Osu, Accra. The group is into the sale of mouthwash, groceries, phone cards, foodstuffs and slippers. They are asking for a total loan amount of GHS 5,500 to improve their businesses from ID-Ghana (Kiva's Partner). 

Francisca, a 43-year-old single woman, has been working at the market selling mouthwash for seven years. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and raise more capital. She has requested a loan to purchase more mouthwash to sell to customers. Francisca hopes to expand her business to live comfortably. She, along with her group members, is very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase more mouthwash to sell to customers.

loans.name: Poniyem

texts.en:
This is the story of Latifatul, daughter of Poniyem:

The economic background of the family is very difficult because only the father works as a laborer whose income is erratic. He works every day, while expenses and daily needs are so much. He is not able to yet again pay for school for the brother who is still in grade four of elementary school. 

“Due to the economic situation of my parents being minimal, I'd love to follow this student loan program so that I could continue my school until completed. I hope this loan from Kiva can ease the burden on my parents. After finishing school, I will try to help the economic situation of my family, and my parents can be happy.”

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Mom is 47 years old and the mother of three children. She grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn income of about 41,000 KHR per day. This is the first time for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy chickens to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sreynal

texts.en:
Living in Kratie province, Sreynal is 28 years old and a mother of four children. To support her living, she earns income to improve her living condition via rice-cropping and selling grocery items. 

For Sreynal, this is the first loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She is now asking for a loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Hendrik

texts.en:
This is the story of Hendrik:

"My hometown is in Nias, precisely in Hilialawa, Uluidanoduo village, South Nias. My hometown, like other hamlets, is situated in a very quiet area and jobs in my village are very scarce. Predominantly, the people work as  laborers. My parents only work as farm laborers who mow rice harvest. While waiting for the harvest, my parents grow crops in the fields. I am the first child of four brothers, three siblings. They are in school and still cost much. Because the economy of our parents is very minimal, I applied for a loan to Kiva. Hopefully, with this loan, I can go to school at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, in the town of Cilacap. And can ease the burden of my parents' life. To fill in my spare time after college, I want to develop a hobby and am looking for a part-time job. With this loan, my parents are very happy; hopefully I can repay the loan, after I finish school and start working. We are very grateful to the lenders who will help us, even though we do not know you personally."

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Huấn

texts.en:
Mr. Huấn works in agriculture, farming food. Huấn is 38 years old and he is married with three children. He lives and works in Bim Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Huấn has been involved in this business for five years. 

The main hardship that Huấn faces in his life is not having a hygeinic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet .

With his business profit, Huấn hopes for her children to find a good job, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang,18, lives with her parents in Phnom Penh City. She is a university student who is majoring in hospitality and tourism. 

Sreyneang faces a financial issue, because her family's financial support is only enough to pay for her daily expenses. She lacks money to pay tuition fees. 

Therefore, she is applying for a loan from Kiva to pay her tuition fees. She promises that she will repay the loan, with interest, punctually, based on the repayment schedule. She honestly thanks lenders for this loan, which provides a much lower interest rate than normal loans. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai has a retail business selling stationary items. 
She is 36 years old and married with two children. Mai lives and works in Dong Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mai has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Mai hopes to build a better house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương works in agriculture, farming food. Phương is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Phương has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet .

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a vendor from Dulag, Leyte. She is thirty-seven years old and a married woman, and she has five children. Her eldest child is 15, and the youngest is 4 years old. She engages in buy-and-sell business, and she sells frozen goods like sweet cooked ham, sausage, hotdogs, and hamburger patties. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years, now. 

 Luzviminda has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP.  She will use it to buy more frozen goods like ham, sausage, and hot dogs. With the additional stock, Luzviminda would be able to offer a wide array of frozen goods and serve more customers.These will create higher earnings and possibly a way to recovery to go back to its normal livelihood activity.

Luzviminda would like to expand her business, to provide her children with proper diets and better living conditions. 
She also wants to grow her business in order to support the education of her children, for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy more frozen goods like ham, sausage, and hot dogs

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Earlier this year, Crisanto joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. This is the first loan ever taken by him from the cooperative. His loan will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets, and in return he sells fish to the local community.

Crisanto hopes to obtain enough revolving funds for the business and acquire enough resources to vend. In so doing, he can gain more income and get the chance to build up a small fish stall operated in its own place in the mini-market lane.

Crisanto is 38 years old and married. He resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with his family. He is peddling fresh fish in the local community to make a living. For over eight  years, it has sustained and provided for his child's education costs. He is hopeful to earn more income and be able to operate his business safely.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Alma Mae

texts.en:
Alma Mae is 24 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a gasoline "buy and sell" business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Alma Mae had not borrowed any loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline "buy and sell" for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Alma Mae aspires to save enough to buy more farmlands.

This photo is of Alma Mae in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ritchel is 36 years old and her child is in school.

Ritchel has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Ritchel has been in this business for 19 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Christian Delhvi

texts.en:
Christian Delhvi is 21 years old and he is the only child in the family. His mother, Delia (shown in the photo), supports the family through her house rental business in the Philippines.

Christian Delhvi is studying Bachelor of Secondary Education with major in Mathematics and is currently in the first of this 4-year course. He is borrowing PHP 16,000 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014 - 2015.

In the future he plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en: Rabiu is an 18-year-old maize farmer from Kofar Pada village in Kaduna state. If he were not a Babban Gona member, Rabiu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to get cash for his immediate needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rabiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan for expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahmadi

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rahmadi. Rahmadi is a 26-year-old man who owns and manages a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Rahmadi is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with a 3-year-old son. Together, this small family lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Living in Jakarta means high living costs for Rahmadi and his family. Therefore, to support his family’s needs, Rahmadi decided to join Ruma 3 months ago. He is excited to do business as a Ruma agent, not only because he can raise his income by selling mobile phone airtime credits, but also because he can learn more about mobile technology use for businesses.
As the demand for mobile airtime increases (especially on the weekends), Rahmadi is applying for the working capital loan from Kiva in order to process more airtime transactions. In the near future, Rahmadi plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he sells, such as utility bill payment service and product catalog service to his community. In the photo, Rahmadi is the one who is pictured sitting in his own small shop.

loans.use: to have working capital to sell airtime credits on the weekends

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 53 years old and has seven children. She is widowed. Socorro works very hard to help her family.

Socorro is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Socorro has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities.

In the future, Socorro would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Duo La Sexta Group

texts.es: Duo la Sexta, doña wendy Mariela su negocio lo tiene porque sus abuelos se lo heredaron, es como una tradición de familia, el sueño siempre fue llegar a tener un buen negocio para llegar a tener mejores ganancias, ella esta agradecida cons Dios y su familia por darle la oportunidad y apoyarla en su negocio, y ahora también a Fape por darLE el crédito, su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener unos dos negocios más con la ayuda de dios y de fape, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en: A member of Duo la Sexta, Wendy Mariela, inherited her business from her grandparents. The business is like a family tradition. Her dream has always been to have a good business to make better profits. She thanks God and her family for having given her this opportunity and now also thanks FAPE for giving her a loan. Her greatest desire is to open one or two more businesses with the help of God and FAPE. She is requesting this loan to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Dúo Kairos De Peronia Group

texts.es:
DUO KAIROS DE PERONIA 
El cual esta integrado por la señora Juana de 54 años de edad quien es madre de 4 niños que aun tiene a su cargo los cuales aun estudian ella tiene muchos años de tener su negocio de venta de telas y ropa en el mercado de su localidad  ella menciona que gracias a DIOS le ha ido muy bien, ya que cuenta con la bendicion de que solo ella vende telas y ropa nueva en su área y  con los créditos que FAPE  le ha otorgado ella ha podido comprar dos locales mas los cuales ella se beneficia alquilándolos  y espera en DIOS  poder cumplir cada una de sus metas ya que cada uno de los sueños y metas que ella tiene es dejar un buen legado a su familia y brindar el mejor estado de de vida para cada uno de ellos y nuevamente toca las puertas de FAPE para la adquisición de un nuevo crédito para la compra de tela para hacer manteles navideños y ropa para la venta así poder tener abastecido y surtido para las épocas que se aproximan
texts.en: The loan group "Duo Kairos de Peronia" was formed by Señora Juana, who is 54 years old. She is the mother of four children and is still responsible for the ones who are still in school. For many years she has had a business of selling cloth and clothing in the market in her town. She mentions thanks to God, for it has gone very well for her, since she has the blessing for being the only one who sells fabric and new clothes in her area. With the loans that FAPE has granted her she has been able to buy two more shops, which she benefits from by renting them. She hopes in God to be able to complete each one of her goals, since each one of the dreams and goals that she has is to leave a good legacy for her family and to offer the best quality of life to each one of them. She is again knocking on the doors of FAPE in order to acquire a new loan for the purchase of clothes for Christmas tablecloths and clothes to be supplied and stocked for the seasons that are approaching.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
Maria Alicia tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Maria Alicia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 05 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de: patos, gallina, cuyes el préstamo le ayudara para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia is 24 years old, and lives with her spouse and child in their own house. They live in a rural area in the Oyotún district, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the Northern coast of Perú. Her community works in agriculture, livestock, and trade. 

Maria Alicia has worked raising and selling poultry for 5 years. Her business is located in her home. She is asking for this loan for capital for her business, in order to buy ducks, hens, and guinea pigs. The loan will help her to have a better investment, with the end goal of increasing her sales and satisfying the needs of her customers. This will allow her to quickly improve her earnings, raise her income and in the end improve the quality of life of her and her family.

loans.use: to buy ducks, hens and guinea pigs to invest in her business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and fertilize his banana crops.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old and married, with five children. With one child in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and cigarettes.

Susana has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, aun continua con la venta de bebidas y antojitos como fuente de ingresos, de esta manera sale a delante con su familia,  la situación económica no ha variado mucho pero si tiene oportunidad de cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para comprar plátanos, bebidas, aceite, gas propano, azúcar, entre otros, seguirá elaborando la venta de tostadas, enchiladas, refrescos, etc.
texts.en: Antonia continues to sell soft drinks and snacks to generate income. This helps her make ends meet for her family. Her financial situation has not changed much, but she is capable of meeting her financial commitments. She is requesting a new loan to buy plantains, drinks, oil, propane gas and sugar, among others. She will continue to prepare tostadas, enchiladas, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy plantains, drinks, oil, propane gas and sugar, among others; she will continue to prepare tostadas, enchiladas, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: La Lomita Group

texts.en:
The eight women in this group live in the La Lomita section of the town of Guineales in the Department of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. This is an agricultural area where most of the men work in the cultivation of bananas and coffee and many of the women work in traditional weaving.  Within this group there are two women who raise and sell chickens, a woman with a very small store, and five who are involved in sales of the typical skirts and blouses of their area.  They are all women who have never had any kind of business training and are looking forward to the classes that Namaste will give them on financial literacy and managing their money.  They also are eager to work with their Business Adviser who will help them develop a business plan and give them advice on how to grow their business.
Dina Raquel (first from left), who was elected president of the group at their first meeting, has a business selling typical clothing door to door. She is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 7 and 4.  The older is in school and the younger has not yet started school. Dina herself only went to school through the second grade.  They live in a small house made of concrete blocks.  Her husband, who works as an assistant to a lawyer in the nearby city of Mazatenango, helped her start her business two years ago. Her dream is to grow her business enough so that she can buy a small piece of land where she can build a better home for her family. She will be using her loan to buy blouses in girls’ sizes, something she does not currently sell and which her customers would like.
Her current monthly profit is 4225 Guatemalan Quetzales and she hopes to increase that to 5608 Quetzales by the end of this nine-month loan cycle with Namaste.

loans.use: She will be using her loan to buy blouses in girls’ sizes

loans.name: Mujeres De Nahuala Group

texts.en:
The six members of this group live in the Nahuala section of the town of Guineales, Department of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. This is an agricultural area where coffee and bananas are grown.  There are a variety of businesses represented in this group, such as sales of tamales, poultry fruit, meat and clothing.  There are weavers of typical clothing as well. The women are looking forward to their work with Namaste as they want to learn how to manage their sales and expenses.  They are eager to grow their businesses with the help of the Business Adviser who will provide them with a business plan and monthly advice on improving their business.
Elena, one of the members of the group, has a business weaving and selling typical blouses and skirts.  She learned weaving from her mother and has worked since she was very young, leaving school after the first grade so she could help support her family. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children ranging in age from 22 to 15.  Her husband is a cook. Her children also left school early to help support the family, getting only from one to six years of school each. She has had her business for 12 years and wants to grow it so she can leave it to her daughters after she is gone. She will use her loan money to hire three employees to help her with the weaving.  She expects that the additional workers will make a big difference in her sales and profits.
Her monthly profit is 6,412 Guatemalan Quetzales and she projects an increase to 11,000 Quetzales by the end of her nine-month cycle with Namaste.

loans.use: to hire three employees to help her with the weaving

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and widowed with eight children. Two of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es:
Martin, utilizo el préstamo anterior para aumentar la productividad de los cultivos de maíz, mejorando así los ingresos y circunstancias familiares.
Requiere de un préstamo nuevo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el arrendamiento del terreno en el que sembrara maíz, le será de ayuda para mantener su negocio y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en: Martin used his previous loan to increase his corn yields, thus improving his income and family situation. He needs a new loan to buy farm supplies and pay the rent on the land where he will grow corn. The loan will help him to continue his business and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay the rent on the land where he will grow corn.

loans.name: Marina Haydee

texts.es: Marina es una mujer trabajadora que cuenta con 44 años de vida en los que siempre ha buscado la manera de salir adelante, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas en su domicilio desde hace 2 años, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado apoyar a su compañero de vida con la economía de su hogar. Marina habita en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 14 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy agradecida de poder contar con este beneficio. La vivienda de Marina es muy humilde ya que está hecha de lámina, por lo que ella desea ir mejorándola poco a poco, pero actualmente lo que más le preocupa es el techo ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking woman who is 44 years old and who has always searched for a way to move ahead.  For two years, she has made a living producing piñatas in her home. Thanks to this, she has managed to support her husband with her household economy. For 8 years, Marina has lived in her own house alongside her husband and their 14 year-old son, for which she feels very grateful.

Marina’s house is very humble, as it is made of sheet metal.  This is why she wishes to gradually improve it little by little, but currently she is most concerned about the roof, as it is deteriorating. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 36 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Vivian has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Danladi

texts.en: Danladi is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Danladi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danladi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Danladi is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 25 años de edad es una mujer que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su familia, y es por ello que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida recorriendo las diferentes calles del municipio para ofrecer su productos que son: mango, pepino, jícama, papaya, sandia, etc. Ella habita desde hace 9 años en vivienda propia al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindarle un lugar propio donde vivir a su familia. La vivienda de Dora está situada sobre un terreno con muchos relieves, por lo que ella se siente preocupada del peligro que pueda correr su vivienda, es por ello que desea construir un muro de contención en el área mostrada en la fotografía, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 25 years old and is a woman who always makes an effort to move forward alongside her family. This is why for the past 3 years, she has made a living visiting the different streets of the municipality to offer her products, including mango, cucumbers, jicama [a Mexican turnip], papaya, watermelon, etc. 

For nine years, she has lived in her own house alongside her husband and her two sons, who are eight and two years old. She feels happy to be able to provide her family with a place of their own to live. Dora’s house is located on land with many hills and mountains, which is why she is worried about the danger that could come overrun her home. This is why she wishes to construct a retaining wall in the area shown in the photograph, and for this reason is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a retaining wall at her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a retaining wall at her house

loans.name: Rebacca Dauda

texts.en:
Rebacca Dauda is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state, in northwest Nigeria. 

Previously, Rebacca Dauda would typically have sold her maize soon after harvest, when the price was lowest, because she needed to meet urgent expenses. However, that was before she became a Babban Gona member.  

Now, with this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rebacca Dauda can store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. She will use the loan to cover her pending expenses, such as food.

Like other members of Babban Gona, Rebecca Dauda intends to expand her farmland with the extra income she earns. She hopes to one day become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses such as food and eliminate the pressure to sell her harvest at low prices.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly is 53 years old. He has a stable home alongside his spouse and has three children ages 12, 8, and 6. He lives in his own, one-story house of rustic material. Yolly and his spouse were born in a small village. He lives in friendly harmony and communion with the members of his small village. He lives in the rural part of the Ntungamo district, which is a community that is dedicated mainly to agriculture and livestock breeding. His house has water.

Yolly’s occupation is coffee farming, and to date he has 2 hectares. He farms the Catimor variety and his plantation is thirteen years old. He is in his third year of production. Yolly has his own agricultural land where the coffee plantation is. He has been working in this occupation for 3 years in the village El Pueblo Lo Hizo in the St. Thomas district. He has experience in coffee farming since in the past he has farmed the Catimor variety. He sells this product to buyers in the area. Additionally, Yolly makes a living in goat breeding and also in the farming of staple food crops for home use. He does all of this on his own land.

The purpose of the loan will be for the maintenance of 2 hectares of coffee in production. With the loan, Yolly will ensure more and better production for 2015. Consequently, he will obtain better income and will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and maintain two hectares of coffee in production.

loans.name: Adzovi Akpénè

texts.fr: Akpénè a 28 ans. Elle est mariée et a 2 enfants.Akpénè réside dans le quartier Totsi, un périphérique de Lomé. Elle a débuté son commerce de pagnes depuis 2004. La clientèle d’Akpénè ne cesse d’accroitre grâce à son accueil et la confiance que lui font ses clients.Pour satisfaire ses clients, elle souhaite augmenter son stock par l’achat de 05 pièces de pagnes HITARGET.
texts.en:
Akpénè is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the Totsi neighborhood, an outlying suburb of Lomé.

Akpénè began selling pagnes [fabric used in traditional clothing] in 2004. Her customer base continues to grow thanks to her [warmth] and her customers' confidence in her. In order to meet her customers' needs, Akpénè wants to increase her stock by purchasing five pagnes from the Hitarget brand.

loans.use: To purchase five pagnes [fabric used in traditional clothing].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to set the ground surrounding her home in concrete

loans.name: Sokayé

texts.fr: Mr Sokayé est revendeur de profession. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des produits d'alimentation générale. Son activité se fait à KPALIME et il s'approvisionne au même lieu. Son premier crédit qu'il demande à WAGES l'aidera à acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Il espère subvenir aux besoins de la famille(Marié, il a 05 enfants en charge) et faire agrandir sa boutique. Sokayé a 42ans avec une ancienneté de 20ans.
texts.en: Mr. Sokayé is a retailer by trade. His business is the sale of general foodstuffs. His business is located in Kpalimé and he gets his supplies in the same location. [T]his first loan that he is seeking from WAGES will help him to purchase merchandise in order to meet customer demand. Mr. Sokayé hopes to meet the needs of his family (a married man, he has five children in his care) and expand his shop. Mr. Sokayé is 42 years old, with 20 years of experience.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Matendo Group

texts.fr: La cliente TUMAINI est âgée de 36 ans et mère de 6 enfants tous étudiants. Elle est présidente au sein du groupe de crédit MATENDO et mariée à un commercant de la place. Elle s’occupe de la vente des produits divers, activité qu’elle a débuté suite au premier fonds reçu de IMF HEKIMA. Le nouveau prêt lui permettra d’approvisionner son entreprise en 6 cartons de piles,  en 2 sacs de sucre, en 2 bidons d’huile et ingrédients de cuisine dans le but d’accroître son entreprise. Elle remercie HEKIMA de tout cœur, pour le soutien sans précédent aux femmes bukaviennes confrontées au manque de moyens.
texts.en:
The client, Tumaini, is 36 years old and the mother of six children, all of them students. She is the president of Matendo Group and is married to a local shopkeeper.

Tumaini sells various goods, a business she began when she first received funds from MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. The new loan will allow her to stock her business with six boxes of batteries, two sacks of sugar, two containers of oil, and cooking ingredients, with the goal of expanding her business.

Tumaini thanks Hekima with all her heart, for their unprecedented support of the women of Bukavu facing a lack of means.

loans.use: To stock her business with six boxes of batteries, two sacks of sugar, two containers of oil, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Noong Luong 15 Group

texts.en:
Tien, 26, is a married Thai woman and the mother of two little girls. One is 12 years old and the other is an infant. Tien and her husband work in agricultural production to provide for the family with various activities, including cultivating rice and corn and raising pigs, chickens and fish. To have capital to expand production, Tien has taken out loans from the Anh Chi Em Program and this time she will use the loan to buy young fish and food for the fish. She said that the high profit gained from the previous loan, which she used for fish farming, motivated her to apply for the loan this time to continue investing in fish.

Tien dreams her family will have a more abundant life and her children will study in a good college and get a good job. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish and food for the fish

loans.name: Jonas

texts.pt:
O senhor Jonas e comerciante e presta servicos como  barbeiro, tem 33 anos de idade casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais dois ainda menores 1 a estudar no ensino secundario vive na casa propria e sustenta também sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar cadeiras de salao, secadores, lavatorios aquecer, maquina de manicure e pedicure, bijuterias estante.
Projectos para o futuro crescer no negocio satisfazendo todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar sua formacao em contabilidade.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Jonas is a businessman providing barber services. He is a 33 year old married father of 3 children: 2 of whom are not yet of school age and the eldest is at secondary school. He lives in his own home and he also supports his mum, sending her money each month.
He says that he will use this loan to buy salon chairs, hairdryers, salon sinks with warm water, a manicure and pedicure machine, and a jewellery display case.
In the future he hopes to grow his business, enabling him to satisfy his customers' every need and to finish his accountancy course.
He says that he is committed to punctually repaying his loan so that he can apply for further loans to fulfil his plans.

loans.use: to buy salon chairs, hairdryers, salon sinks with warm water, manicure and pedicure machines, and a jewellery display case.

loans.name: Aziypa

texts.ru: Азийпа, 48 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, самому младшему- 15 лет. Семья Азийпы очень дружная и сплоченная. У Азийпы образование среднее, уже более 20 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день есть 40 овец и 2,0 Га земельной доли, где Азийпа выращивает кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ее ежемесячный доход в общей сложности составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Азийпа в целях развития своего бизнеса обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Азийпе расширить ее деятельность и накопить средства на постройку дома для сына.
texts.en:
Aziypa is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five children, the youngest of which is 15 years old. Aziypa's family is very friendly and tight-knit. Aziypa has a secondary education and for more than 20 years has been involved in agriculture. Currently, she has 40 sheep and a 2.0-hectare land share, where Aziypa grows cucumbers and clover for farm consumption and sale. Her total monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, Aziypa applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). The amount received will be used to purchase calves for fattening and resale.

Aziypa will use profit from the loan to expand her activity and to save money to build a home for her son.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Maryury

texts.en:
Four years ago, Maryury came to the US.  She noticed in her FL area, there were no small convenience/grocery stores. Eight months ago, she and her husband opened up a small grocery store in a shopping center, facing a residential neighborhood.  Maryury says, “We are proud to have won the trust of the community through our quality and customer service.”

As a new business, though, Maryury is well aware of many additional expenses. The business would like to have more inventory, as well as obtain licenses to accept food stamps. “If we could expand and add these things, our business would grow significantly,” Maryury says. This business supports Maryury, her husband, and two young children.

This loan will help Maryury build her store’s inventory and expand product offerings. Even though her business is young, Maryury is aiming high: “The future of our company will be to expand. We want to become a chain of supermarkets.”

loans.use: to purchase inventory and expand product offering for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
When Rosaura opened her salon in Crown Heights, it was the only business on the block. She took a chance, but was confident that her 20 years of experience styling hair in the Dominican Republic and Brooklyn would draw customers to her business. And with four children to support, she was determined to make her business a success.

It wasn’t easy: “I knew how I wanted to treat my customers but I needed to learn how to run my business.” Her business success has fostered economic growth in her neighborhood. She provides good-paying jobs to four women. And it doesn’t stop there. Seeing the success of Rosaura’s salon, several other businesses have opened on her block. Rosaura has played a key role in the revitalization of her neighborhood and it’s been recognized by the City.  Last year, on her salon’s first year anniversary, the City presented Rosaura an award thanking her for creating employment opportunities for women. “I love serving my community. I wish I could do more.”

Rosaura recently celebrated the two-year anniversary of her salon and would like to make some upgrades to accommodate different client needs. For instance, she has created a special section in her salon to provide privacy for her many Muslim women clients who live in the neighborhood. Rosaura will use this loan to make renovations to her salon and looks forward to enhancing the experience of her clients.

loans.use: to pay for salon renovations.

loans.name: Institut Mushekere Group

texts.fr: Monsieur NGERANYA est marié et père de 8 enfants tous étudiants. En son état d’enseignant, à l’âge de 44 ans est président du groupe de crédit Institut MUSHEKERE. Il vient de solliciter un prêt pour améliorer son habitat. Il remercie IMF HEKIMA pour le soutien aux enseignants en proie d’un salaire insignifiant.
texts.en: Mr. Ngeranya is married and the father of eight children, all of them students. A teacher, he is president of Institut Mushekere Group at the age of 44. Mr. Ngeranya has just requested a loan to improve his housing. He thanks MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima for their support of teachers jeopardized by low wages.

loans.use: To improve his housing.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Margret will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Margret plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a pig.

In total Margret’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Lydiah's Group

texts.en:
Lydiah is 42 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Lydiah joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Lydiah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Lydiah 's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. In the past, Dahiru would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, when the price was lowest, because he needed to pay urgent expenses.

However, now that he is a member, with this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. He will use his loan to cover pending expenses such as food and clothing.

When asked about his goals, Dahiru expressed a desire to build a better home with the extra income he earns. In the long run, his aims to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like clothing and food, eliminating the pressure to sell his harvest at low prices.

loans.name: John D.

texts.en: John D. is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, John D. would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, John D. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, John D. is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Msingi Group

texts.fr: Madame NGALA est  mère de 7 enfants  à l’âge de 52 ans, présidente du groupe MSINGI et mariée à un Instituteur. Elle s’occupe de la vente des bottes au marché central de la ville  depuis 1999. Elle vient de solliciter un nouveau  prêt  pour acheter  2  sacs de bottes et payer le transport. Son vœu est   de  devenir  un grand fournisseur des bottes de la province. Ainsi, elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngala is the mother of seven children; at the age of 52, she is president of Msingi Group and married to a primary school teacher.

Mrs. Ngala has been selling boots at the central town market since 1999. She has just requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of boots and pay for shipping. Her wish is to become a major provider of boots in the province. She would like to thank Hekima for the support they provide to poor businesswomen.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of boots and pay for shipping.

loans.name: Zulma Emerita

texts.es:
Zulma, está acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos; es propietaria de una tienda de artículos varios, su familia le ayuda a atender el negocio, la fundo hace 6 años, con el paso del tiempo ha ido mejorando el inventario, está actividad la aprendió a desempeñar con ayuda de su madre, la ventaja es la zona en que reside,  puesto que no hay mucha competencia.
Utilizará el capital para comprar cereales, granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, golosinas, etc., para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, su objetivo es tener más mercadería para que sus ventas sean mayores y tener una mejor situación económica.
Sus proyectos son expandir su negocio, ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Zulma lives with her partner and two children. She owns a convenience store and her family help her to look after the business. She opened the shop 6 years ago. Over time she has improved the stock which she has learnt to do with the help of her mother. The advantage is the area where the shop is because there is not a lot of competition. She will use this loan to by cereals, basic grains, meat, cold meat, candy, etc., in order to meet the needs of her customers. Her aim is to have more goods so that she can sell more and so that she has a better financial situation.
Her plans are to expand her business, offer new products to her customers and continue to help her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals, basic grains, meat, cold meat, candy, etc., in order to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Rahiya

texts.ru: Рахия, 55 лет, замужем, мать 3 дочерей- студенток, образование у Рахии высшее, много лет она проработала учителем математики, сейчас на пенсии и занимается животноводством и полеводством. Рахия добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 3 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади. Также 1,23 ГА поливной земли, она выращивает ячмень. Ежедневно Рахия реализует молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади. На прибыль от кредита Рахия планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Rahiya is 55 years old, married, and the mother of three daughters- all students. Rahiya has a higher education. For many years she made a living as a mathematics teacher. Now she is retired and is involved in raising livestock and crops. Rahiya has achieved very good results. She has three cows, 20 sheep, and two horses. She also has a 1.23 hectare land share, where she grows barley. Every day, Rahiya sells milk. Monthly income amounts to about 16,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase a horse.

With the profit from the loan, Rahiya plans to expand her farm and to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy one horse in order to grow her business

loans.name: Kenzhegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Кенжегул среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Кенжегул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 3 коровы, 1 теленок, 4 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Кенжегул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для закупки лошади. Кенжегул намерена развивать свой бизнес, увеличивая тем самым ее доходы, что позволит накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Kenzhegul is 41 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. Kenzhegul has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock, having begun 12 years ago. Thanks to Kenzhegul's perseverance, dedication and hard work, she currently has: three cows, one calf, and four goats. Monthly income amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS).

Kenzhegul applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 somKGS) to buy a horse.

Kenzhegul intends to grow her business, thereby increasing her income, which she will save to purchase an automobile.

loans.use: to buy a horse in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi vit avec sa famille couturière et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 04ans et 03 mois. Il est mécanicien de profession et a ouvert son atelier 2009. Il se fait aidé par 01 personne et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des machines. Il espère agrandir l'activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Kokouvi lives with his family - [they are] fashion designers - and their two children in Lomé. One child is four years old and the other is three months old. Kokouvi is a mechanic by trade and opened his workshop in 2009. He is assisted by one person and is seeking a first loan to purchase machines. He hopes to expand his business and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To purchase machines.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
Manju, the featured member of Maa Santoshi Self Help Group, is a permanent resident of village Bhaludongri of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She hails from a Schedule caste family. Schedule Caste people in India are considered to be the most backward. Around 95% of the people of this caste are socially and economically backward. To triumph over this situation steps are being taken by the government and NGOs in respect to education, empowerment, employment and livelihood. The young and confident lady standing with raised hand in the photo is Manju. She is a married lady of 27 years, having a son of 6 years. She resides with her husband and their son in a small mud house. 

Manju has a small piece of land where she does vegetable cultivation.  She and her husband manage the vegetable cultivation farm. They produce vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, carrots, cabbages, chilli, cucumbers, papayas, ladies fingers (okra) etc. in the farm. Manju takes the vegetable produce of her farm to the daily market of the nearest town for selling. She earns a minimum of 400 INR per day and according to her, this is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. 

Manju wants to expand her business by taking a loan. So she motivated eleven other women from her village and formed the Self Help Group, then contacted Mahashakti Foundation and took a loan of 168,000 INR. Manju has taken 16,000 INR from that and she will utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Manju dreams of constructing a house and providing better education for her son. She hopes to give her family a bright future through her hard work.

Among the other eleven members of this group, ten members are doing vegetable and cotton cultivation and the other member is running a tent house. All of the members are very much hopeful to increase their income for better livelihood.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 56 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Alice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Calistus' Group

texts.en:
Calistus, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 6 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. 

With a portion of this loan, Calistus will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life. Calistus plans to use the profits he gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total Calistus’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Moses, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 26 years old, is married and has one child. Moses has been a farmer for six years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Moses isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Moses will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Moses's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 29 лет, не замужем, детей нет. У Саламат средне-специальное образование, она занимается полеводством и животноводством, также оказывает услуги по реставрации одежды. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Саламат есть 1 корова,5 овец, также на 3,72 ГА поливной земли, она выращивает картофель. ежемесячный совокупный доход Саламат составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Она очень любит швейное дело и хочет развить его, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку электрической швейной машинки. Доходы Саламат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, а в будущем она мечтает открыть свой швейный магазин.
texts.en:
Salamat is 29 years old, is unmarried and has no children. Salamat has a specialized secondary education. She raises crops and livestock, and also offers services in restoring clothes. Currently on her homestead Salamat has one cow, five sheep, and also on 3.72 hectares of land, she grows potatoes. Salamat's total monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

She very much loves sewing work and wants to grow it, therefore she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy an electronic sewing machine.

Salamat plans to invest the income in further expanding her business and in the future she dreams of openi9ng her own sewing store.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical sewing machine in order to provide restoration services.

loans.name: Bonfaces' Group

texts.en:
Bonface's Group is formed by 10 farmers in the Kakamega North district and is being represented by Bonface, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 44 years old, is married, and has been a farmer for more than 20 years. He is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Bonface isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since.

This year, Bonface will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light and his children will be able to study during the dark hours.

Using this loan, Bonface's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Los Pilares  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como 4 esquinas en la  ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Pilares. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura o al comercio en general. Ellas decidieron unirse tiempo atrás para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda  la institución y con los créditos han podido mejorar sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Shirley, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es ayudante de albañilería.
Doña Sherley es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y con esto  ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende zapatillas y  productos de catalogo de Yanbal, Avon, Belcorp  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres o cuatro  días a la semana a sus recorridos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en su trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y cosméticos. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area known as 4 corners in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador, every fortnight the members of the credit group Los Pilares meet. They all work doing different activities, such as farming or business in general. They decided to get together a while ago to be able to get access to loans that this organization offers and with these loans they have been able to improve their businesses.
One of the members of this group is Shirley, she is 34 years old, she is married and has three children who are 9, 6 and 4 years old and who study at school. Her husband is a construction assistant. Shirley is a very determined woman who likes to work in order to get ahead and by doing that she helps her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children. She works in business, she sells shoes and catalogue products from Yanbal, Avon and Belcorp (Beauty products, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door to door and does this 3 or 4 days a week. She also sells to her best known customers in her house. She sells goods on credit and collects payments every eight days. She has been doing this for three years and it has allowed her to get ahead because her husband does not earn very much from his work. This loan is to buy shoes, perfumes, creams, costume jewellery and cosmetics. She has been with this credit group from the beginning and she likes this because of the help that the loans have given her. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, creams, costume jewellery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr: Homme de 48ans, Mr Koku est mariée avec en charge  4 enfants. 03 d'entre eux sont scolarisés. Il est sculpteur de profession. Après sa formation, il a ouvert son atelier à KPALIME lieu où il exerce son activité depuis 1995. Vue la qualité du service rendu, les demandes viennent de part et d'autres et il sollicite un premier crédit dans notre institution WAGES pour acheter des bois(matières premières) pour satisfaire ses demandes. A l'avenir, Mr Koku espère agrandir son activité et construire une nouvelle maison.
texts.en: Mr. Koku, a 48-year-old man, is married and has four children to support. Three of them are provided with education. He is a sculptor by trade. After his training, he opened his workshop in KPALIME, where he has been operating since 1995. Given the quality of his work, special orders come in from all over. And he is requesting an initial loan from our microfinance institution WAGES to purchase some wood (raw material) to meet the demand. For the future, Mr. Koku hopes to expand his business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for carving

loans.name: Flor De Chupol Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank's Flor de Chupol Group was formed in the rural area of Chichicastenango called, Chuipol. There are ten women in the group, all of whom have a great desire to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. They see hope in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and education on a variety of practical subjects.

The President of the Trust Bank is a young, 23-year-old woman, named Juana, who married quite young. Juana has a textile business and creates typical blouses that are elaborately decorated. She employs three women. 

Juana is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she hopes will be funded by Kiva investors. She will use the funds to purchase a quantity of good-quality thread, as well as other supplies for the business. Juana realizes that this is the time of the year when demand increases due to the holidays, graduations, and other celebrations.

Her three young children motivate her to work hard, so that they can have nutritious food on the table and attend school. One of her children is already in school and another is about to begin his education. Juana was able to attend elementary school and realizes the value of a good education. She is optimistic about the future. The women in the Trust Bank admire Juana because she knows how to read and write. She is inspirational to her friends in the Trust Bank.

The Trust Bank's Flor de Chuipol Group very much appreciates the opportunity to participate in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge. Through their kindness and generosity in funding these much needed loans, Kiva investors are valuable partners. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of good-quality thread, as well as other supplies for her textile business.

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge “Cielo” (which means “Sky or Heaven”) Group is located in Quetzaltenango, a city located in the western highlands that is the second largest city in Guatemala. The population is about 64% Mam Maya.

Roberta, a member of the group, is 48 years old and has four children.  She has a basic education. However, with great effort, she was able to provide a primary school education for her children.  

A few years ago, Roberta was widowed. Unfortunately, her husband died while searching for the American dream. His death forced her to seek new sources of income to support her family. In order to excel, Roberta joined the "Cielo" group and now is the president. 

She is now requesting another loan to purchase more vegetable items such as cauliflower, onions and carrots as well as limes and corn in order to make tortillas.

Through a loan from Friendship Bridge, Roberta was able to recover from her loss by having a stall and selling vegetables in the Quetzaltenango marketplace.

Roberta is an impressive example of the empowerment Maya women develop when they receive micro-loans and non-formal education through Friendship Bridge and the investors of Kiva.  She and the other ladies of the "Cielo" group are extremely grateful to Kiva investors for supporting their loans and the monthly non-formal education programs on subjects like budgeting, bookkeeping and customer service.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable items such as cauliflower, onions and carrots as well as limes and corn in order to make tortillas.

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 9 farmers in the Kakamega North district, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Fridah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Fridah plans to use the profits she gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Fridah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
Yane is a 45 year old, single woman who lives with her parents. Initially, she was working in a beauty salon after she took some beauty courses. When she had enough capital and confidence, she established her own beauty salon in the front of her parent’s house. 

As the business has been running for 4 years, Yane has got many customers, who sometimes come to her salon or ask her to come to their house. Yane provides the service of makeup and hair treatments such as hair straightening, cream baths, masks, or hair cut, etc. In order to help her in her business Yane is hiring an employee to help her in the salon. She pays the employee the amount of IDR 400,000 per month, excluding a bonus in the high season such as in December, when the salon has many customers.
