Currently she needs more cash to purchase equipment for the salon, but her money is not enough to do so. Therefore she is asking for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. 

The loan will be used to buy the salon equipment that she ordered from Java, such as a hair dryer, medicine for hair treatments, etc.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment that she ordered from Java, such as a hair dryer, medicine for hair treatments, etc

loans.name: Muzusa Group

texts.fr: La cliente BACHIBONE, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 7 enfants, mariée à un commerçant est présidente du groupe MUZUSA.Femme commerçante de longue date,elle vend des produits divers alimentaires dans la rue.Elle sollicite le nouveau prêt pour se procurer 50kgs de farine, 20kgs de pommes de terre,10 litres d’huile et 1 sac de braise.Son reve est de prosperer dans le commerce.Ainsi, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: This client, BACHIBONE, is 33 years old and the mother of seven. Married to a merchant, she is the president of the group MUZUSA. A long-time woman merchant, BACHIBONE sells a variety of grocery items on the street. She is requesting a new loan to procure 50 kg of flour, 20 kg of potatoes, 10 liters of oil, and a sack of charcoal. Her dream is to prosper in her commerce. So, she thanks HEKIMA for its support of low-income women.

loans.use: to procure 50 kg of flour, 20 kg of potatoes, 10 liters of oil, and a sack of charcoal

loans.name: Aurora Group

texts.en:
With a population of 250,000, Quetzaltenango is the commercial center for the southwestern region of Guatemala. It is also known by its indigenous name Xelaju or Xela. It is the second largest city in Guatemala and considered by many to be one of the fastest growing cities in Central America. 

Fifteen ladies seeking a higher standard of living and a more prosperous future have banded together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called Aurora. Doña Brenda, an enthusiastic and optimistic member of the group, is the president. She is 33 years old and was able to attend primary school. Doña Brenda rents a small location where she sells used clothing from the United States. In addition, for three years she has had a fruit business. She is requesting her first loan from KIVA. She will use the funds to expand her inventory of clothing and purchase more fruit.

As an adult, she was motivated to return to school and is about to receive her high school diploma. Doña Brenda is very happy that her three teenage children are in school. She understands that a good education is key to success.

Each of the fifteen women in the Aurora Trust Bank appreciate the assistance and generosity of Kiva investors. They are committed to paying back their loans fully and on time. The women look forward to sustaining and expanding their small businesses. We look forward to reporting on their progress in the future!

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to improve sales

loans.name: Tushukuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente BINYUNGU est âgée de 45 ans, divorcée et mère de 6 enfants tous allant à l’école. Elle occupe le poste de Présidente du groupe TUSHUKURU où elle a obtenu un prêt pour soutenir son activité de vente des boissons à son domicile entreprise depuis 1998. Le pret va acheter 8 casiers de Primus.Son objectif est d'agrandir son entreprise, payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et les nourir. Au final,elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: This client, BINYUNGU, is 45 years old, divorced, and the mother of six children, all going to school. She occupies the post of president of the group TUSHUKURU, where she obtained a loan to support her business selling drinks at her home business, since 1998. The loan will be used to purchase 8 cases of Primus beer. Her goal is to expand her enterprise, pay her children’s schooling fees, and to feed her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to purchase 8 cases of Primus beer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase varied garments and footwear tfor resale.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip is 72 years old and has 6 children. He has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Philip is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 8 farmers in the Kakamega North district, Kenya.

Philip started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Philip’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive 1 solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman's face has been pixelated because she is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She has made a living selling clothing for two years. Her business is located in her place of residence. She has a lot of regular customers because of the quality of the clothes and the good prices. 

The young woman lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She is asking for a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale to be able to continue selling and therefore to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Juliefer

texts.en:
Juliefer is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Juliefer is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juliefer would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 40 years old and has two children.  She is married and both of her children are in school.

Lorena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine, pictured above, is a group leader. She represents her group, which is formed of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Josephine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Josephine plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Josephine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed of eight farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rosemary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rosemary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rosemary's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Mr. Batsukh, 60 years old, lives with his wife, son and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been selling clothes since 2012 and expanded his business successfully due to his previous loan. 

His wife has retired from work and stays at home, taking care of household chores. Their daughter began to work as an accountant after teaching Russian at a high school. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating, so he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his house before winter. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned so fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 44-year-old married mother of three children from Matag-ob, Leyte. She earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. For more than 14 years, this business has provided her the income that she needs for sustaining her family's needs and for the schooling of her children.

Chona is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar, soda and beverages, rice, soap and toiletries. A loan will help her to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers into her store. In the future, Chona hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more necessary revenue.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar, soda and beverages, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Fredah's Group

texts.en:
Fredah, pictured above, is a group leader. She represents her group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Fredah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Fredah plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total, Fredah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
A 53-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines, Elizabeth makes a living through her retail sales of medicines and food supplements. Elizabeth has five children, and her husband earns additional income through farming.

Elizabeth has been engaged in the business for more than 15 years now. As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy more medicines and food supplements. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to the buyers in her place.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and food supplements.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 25 years old and has three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has a retail store that sells assorted groceries and vegetables to generate additional income, while her husband does farming.

Michelle has been five years in this field. She is working well every day in order to provide income for the family and to help improve their living situation.

Michelle requested this loan to purchase equipment and more groceries and vegetables to sell in her store in order to increase her sales. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may continue her plan of renovating their house for a comfortable living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and more groceries and vegetables to sell in her store in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Sheila has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more coffee, sugar and powdered milk.

Sheila has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, sugar and powdered milk.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, luego de haber sido empleada en una heladería decidió emprender su propio negocio en el año 2012. En su  heladería ofrece paletas, conos, galletas y helados empacados en el horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. de lunes a domingo.  Sus ventas se realizan de contado, y sus clientes son vecinos, amigos y transeúntes residentes del municipio de Soledad.  Sus compras a los proveedores las cancela de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crdikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual    mejorará su stock de productos  y dará una oferta variada con la que incrmentará sus ventas, comprando: paletas, galletas heladas, etc en un mayor volumen.  Dina tiene 34 años y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años y una hija de 16 años de edad.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio y su desafío tener mas fuentes de financiación.  Dina trabaja con mucho compromiso para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Having been employed in an ice cream parlor, Dina decided to launch her own business in 2012. In her ice cream parlor she offers popsicles, cones, cookies and packaged ice creams. Her working schedule is from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m, from Monday to Sunday. Her sales are on cash basis and her customers are neighbors, friends and passersby who live in the municipality of Soledad. 

She pays for her supplier purchases with cash. Currently she is applying for a credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will improve her product stock and provide a varied selection. In this way she will improve her sales, buying popsicles and ice cream treats in greater volume. 

Dina is 34 years old and has a 15-year-old son and 16-year-old daughter. Her goal is to someday improve the appearance of her business. Her challenge is finding more sources of financing. Dina is working with a great deal of commitment so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy popsicles and ice cream treats in greater volume.

loans.name: Gemima Beatriz

texts.es:
Gemima de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta el 7° grado, no continuo sus estudios porque ya sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos como para poder darle mas estudio, entonces decidieron enseñarle a trabajar para que les ayudara en los gastos de la casa. Esta soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y Gemima les ayuda en la siembra de hortalizas como pepino, tomate, chile verde, cebolla etc., y a la siembra de maíz y frijol, lo hace desde hace unos años; para trasladarse a su trabajo Gemima camina junto con sus padres 1 kilometro, desempeñándolo en el horario de 2:00 pm a 5:30 pm todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar 2 vacas lecheras, las cuales cuidara y dentro de un periodo espera poder obtener un poco mas de ingresos para ayudar mas económicamente a sus padres.

El sueño de Gemima es ampliar el negocio de animales y seguir estudiando para tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gemima, 21, went to school up to 7th grade but didn’t continue because her parents did not have the financial resources to allow her to stay in school. So they decided to teach her to work to help them with the household expenses. 
She is single, has no children, and lives with her parents, helping them grow vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc., and also corn and beans. She has been doing this for several years. To get to the fields, Gemima and her parents walk one kilometer, and they work every day from 2:00 pm to 5:30 pm.
The loan she is requesting is to buy two dairy cows, which she will take care of, and she hopes to make a little more income to help her parents financially.
Gemima’s dream is to expand her livestock business and to get more education to have better job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows, which she will take care of, and she hopes to make a little more income.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 60 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Susana has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Susana would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta lives in Oe-cusse and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities for a few years with her own working capital and she make her best from it. She has a very high interest in doing business. She has a small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including sugar, rice, cigarettes, detergent, noodles, pens, shampoo, sweets and other things to sell.  She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cigarettes, detergent,  noodles, pens, shampoo, sweets and other things to sell.

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en: Mrs. Davaakhuu, 54 years old, is one of the trustworthy clients and pays her loan without any delay. She has borrowed many times and used her loans efficiently, such as for paying tuition fees, and buying equipment and furniture. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to buy cooking equipment such as a freezer, oven and cooking pot set in order to provide vocational training to people who want to work as cooks.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment such as a freezer, oven and cooking pot set.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four additional computer units

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and get higher capital.  Purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC helped to increase her sales and to expand her offering. Her previous loan was repaid successfully because she earned better income from this. She took a new loan recently to purchase rice and corn grits in addition to her stock.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate their house for a safer and more comfortable living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits in addition to her stock.

loans.name: Phonsawang Group

texts.en:
Khuan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Some people in the village, including Khuan, are able to buy bottled water. Khuan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter.

Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases the disposable income of users like Khuan because it enables them to spend less money to purchase bottled water and charcoal and to spend less time foraging for wood. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3 to 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakadang Group

texts.en: Phae's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Phae's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Phae is excited that he, like Nam, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Phae, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Phae and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decrease the time spent foraging for firewood. Phae's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Donemuang Group

texts.en: Deang is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Deang's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  Even though some people in the village, including Deang, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Deang and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Deang's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Khorkxang Group

texts.en: Khamtan's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Khamtan's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Khamtan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Khamtan, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Khamtan and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decrease the time spent foraging for firewood. Khamtan's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: María Selsa

texts.es:
María de 60 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta el 6° grado, esta viuda su esposo murió hace 29 años y es madre de 1 hijo de 35 años de edad, el cual ya esta casado y trabaja para los gastos de su familia.

 María vive con su sobrina y el esposo pero nadie depende de ella. María se dedica al cuido de 4 vacas lecheras las cuales le producen mucha leche, se dedica a esto desde hace 22 años trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres, para trasladarse a su trabajo María camina 1 kilometro trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 11:00 am, y por la tarde se dedica a la costureria.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar 4 vacas lecheras mas, así logrará producir mas leche la cual venderá para obtener ganancias y con ello poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es ampliar el hato ganadero para poder producir mas leche y así lograra tener siempre la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a 60-year-old housewife. She attended school until sixth grade. Her husband died 29 years ago, leaving her a widow. She is also the mother of a 35-year-old son who is already married and works to pay for his own household expenses. 

María lives with her niece and her husband but no one is financially dependent on her. María makes a living looking after 4 cows that produce a lot of milk for her. She has been doing this for 22 years and it is a job that her parents taught her how to do. To get to work, María walks 1 kilometre, she then works from 7:00 am to 11:00 am and in the evenings she works as a seamstress. 

The loan that she is asking for is to purchase 4 more dairy cows so that she can produce more milk. She will sell the milk to make income, which will enable her to improve her quality of life. 

María's dream is to increase her cattle heard so that she can produce more milk and therefore always maintain the sustainability of her business.

loans.use: to purchase 4 dairy cows to produce milk.

loans.name: Dongkang Group

texts.en:
Bounta's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Bounta, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Bounta is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. 

The water filter also increases disposable income for users like Bounta due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works for three - five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nasaart Group

texts.en:
Hong's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Hong, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Hong is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Hong due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a forty-nine-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She and her husband have five children. Three of them are still attending to school.

Merlinda is engaged in a food vending business. She sells puto (rice cake), biko (Filipino rice cake made from sticky rice, locally known as malagkit), coconut milk, and brown sugar.  She has been in the food vending business for almost nine years now. 

Merlinda requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients such as sticky rice, rice flour, brown sugar, and coconut for her food vending business. These are essential ingredients that will help improve the output of her food vending business. Through this, she can now provide her children with the basic needs including proper diets and quality education.

Merlinda would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood and also  the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business such as sticky rice, rice flour, brown sugar, and coconuts

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días sale desde muy temprano a recibir el pescado que su esposo recoge en el lago para luego recorrer las calles del municipio ofreciendo sus productos. Ella tiene 6 años de habitar en vivienda humilde pero propia al lado de su esposo y sus hijos, pero desde hace algún tiempo su vivienda no es un lugar adecuado en donde habitar ya que se desplomo por un temblor. Ana desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir su vivienda de lámina pero con un poco más de seguridad, ya que la que se observa en la fotografía carece de materiales.
texts.en: Ana, who is 38 years old, is a hard-working woman who goes out every day at a very early hour to receive the fish that her husband gathers from the lake in order to then go through the streets of the town offering her products. For six years she has lived in a home that is simple but is their own, at the side of her husband and their children. But for some time her house has not been an adequate place to live, since it collapsed due to an earthquake. Ana wants to acquire a loan with FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to build a house of metal sheeting but with a little more security, since what can be seen in the photograph lacks materials.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to build her house

loans.name: Burgadagbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Burgadagbaatar, 34 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a salesman at a bricks manufacturing company since 1998. His wife is cook and works at restaurant. Their daughter stays at kindergarten. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,100,000 MNT to install an electric heater into his house in order to burn less coal for heating. Reduction in coal usage will contribute to clean air efforts.

loans.use: to install an electric heater in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Lammalath Group

texts.en:
Keota's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Keota's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Keota is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. 

Even though some people in the village, including Keota’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Keota and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Keota's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is very dedicated to his study and  wants to become successful in the future. He studied Seafarer in a university. His parents were earning income from their own farm. He had six siblings living with his family. 

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC  to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, he wants to become a successful seafarer.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Khorkhead Group

texts.en:
Khamphee is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Khamphee's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  

Even though some people in the village, including Khamphee’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. 

Khamphee and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Khamphee's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor es una mujer trabajadora que cuenta con 36 años de edad de los cuales 20 ha dedicado a prestar sus servicios domésticos en una residencial. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años al lado de su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad. La vivienda de Flor carece de materiales que puedan darle mayor seguridad ya que está hecha de pedazos de plástico y tela metálica, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir su vivienda de lámina ya que ella siente que así tendrá un poco más de seguridad para su familia y sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: Flor is a hardworking woman who is 36 years old. She has been working as a domestic in a home for the past twenty years. She has been living in her own home for eight years with her eight-year-old little boy. Flor's house is not made out of safe materials, because it was built with pieces of plastic and metal screens. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in sheet metal, wood, and nails to rebuild her home with sheet metal. She thinks this way her family and her few belongings will be somewhat better protected.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood, and nails to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
The Triwana Sari Group made the payment of 19,500,000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell us that they earned an increase in profits during the loan period of six months. The pigs grew fat and healthy. They sold the pigs at a high price because there was a lot of demand from the market. The situation stimulated their spirits to run the businesses. The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the clients continues smoothly and lasts longer. 

Ni Komang, as the leader, controlled and monitored the members of her group. She was helped by other boards. She sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She saved all the profits and used them later for business capital. Three members succeeded with their businesses and decide to continue with their own capital and three new members signed in to replace them.

The Triwana Sari Group received a new loan of 19,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used to increase the number of piglets, to renovate the barns and to purchase superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the businesses by themselves. They already have savings and use it for capital.

Ni Komang is a housewife and she has two children. Both of them are still in elementary school. Her husband works as a farmer. She will use the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. She hopes she can have enough savings soon to continue the business by herself. Ni Komang and the members of Triwana Sari feel happy to have received the support from all lenders, Kiva and MUK. Two of the members couldn’t attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at their Temple.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jebaud Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek is the head of the Jebaud Lestari group, living daily as a pig farmer. She lives with her husband and a child. Ni Kadek is trying to develop a pig business by borrowing 2,500,000 IDR from MUK.
 
From the sale of 2 pigs in this period, Ni Kadek managed to get a profit of 750,000 IDR. The gain is very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to the increasingly expensive necessities of life.

Because the Holidays for Hinduism are approaching, Ni Kadek with the Jebaud Lestari group decided to continue borrowing from the MUK because the loans are especially helpful in developing pig businesses. 

Ni Kadek wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs for pig barbeques. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed for them. The pig for pig barbeques are usually kept for only two or three months and then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and clean the cage. Ni Kadek saves her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.

One member resigned from the group because she had to move to another city, and she was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn finds pleasure in doing her vegetable gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 23 and single, she busies herself helping the family survive. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for giving her capital to support her vegetable gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Genelyn wishes to become a supplier of vegetables for the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as rice, wheat, milk, cooking oil, aqua, coffee, noodles, cigarettes, candies, shampoo and other things to sell including soft drinks. She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of $300.00. Maria wants to open a big store in the future so she is taking this loan as good management to improve her business and to increase her income in the future. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat, milk, cooking oil, aqua, coffee, noodles, cigarettes, candies, shampoo and other things to sell including soft drinks.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. Miguel de 25 años de edad joven emprendedor que se ha  decidido a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotería para tener ingresos económicos para el beneficio de su familia y en mejorar las condiciones de vida. 

La actividad que el desempeña con todo empeño es la venta de abarrotería en su comunidad dicho negocio a el le a funcionado porque no tiene mucha competencia por el lugar y eso le genera ganancias para poder sustentar a su familia que tanto lo necesitan, para tener una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para tener surtida su tienda con productos de primera necesidad a la  disposición de las personas de su comunidad, los sueños de el es la compra de un local más en el centro de su comunidad y así expandir su negocio para que el tenga mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida que en la actualidad no son las adecuadas.
texts.en:
Life brought Miguel the opportunity of working as an employee in a grocery store. He had been hoping for a door to open and was looking forward to what lay beyond. He found what he wanted to do in life. At age 25, he is an enterprising young man who decided to start his own business selling groceries. He started it in order to have enough income for his family and improve their living conditions.

He runs his business with lots of dedication. Selling groceries in his community works well for him because there is not much competition nearby and he is able to generate enough profit to support his family. They need him in order to be able to have better living conditions in the near future.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy merchandise for his grocery store and stock up on basic items for his customers. He would like to buy another retail space downtown in order to expand his business. That would allow him to improve his living conditions, which are currently not adequate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
After passing the loan period, the Taman Indah group succeeded in paying off all of the loan on time. During the loan period, they kept their pigs well away from disease and they grew healthy. The pigs always are fed with nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Wayan sold her fattening pigs and earned enough profit. She’s very happy for the result. Her husband and all the family feel the benefits. The children can go to school and their daily needs are fulfilled. Her dream to renovate her kitchen became true. She said thanks to Lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business. 

After evaluating the last loan period, the Taman Indah group decided to continue their loan with MUK. They still need the loan to increase their business, and they will stop after they all have enough savings to use as capital to run the businesses by themselves.

Ni Wayan used her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets. To reduce the cost, she gives a mixed feed made from various kinds of leaves, such as banana leaf. She hopes that in the next 5 months the pigs can grow healthy and bring a satisfactory price. All the profit will be saved for capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase twoe superior piglets

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 55 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que todos los días se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de minutas y siberianos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre lo esperan para degustar sus productos. Él habita junto a su esposa, sus 3 hijos y su suegra en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con este beneficio. Pedro desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: jarabes, jaleas, paletas y siberianos para poder obtener más ganancias y surtir más su negocio con la venta de paletas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 55 years old. He is a hardworking man who does his best each day to support his household through his business, selling snow cones and popsicles. He has been in business for many years, so he already has a good amount of customers who are always expecting him and waiting to taste his products. 

He lives with his wife, their three children and his mother-in-law in his house, which he is very happy to own. Pedro wants to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in syrups, jams, popsicles, and shaved ice so that he can make a higher profit and stock up on a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to invest in syrups, jams, popsicles, and shaved ice.

loans.name: Ma. Cutie

texts.en:
Ma. Cutie is 37 years old and married with one child in school. She earns a living by farming ginger in the Philippines. She has been farming ginger for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ma. Cutie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie, who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, is 61 years old, and married with five adult-age children. She has a sari-sari store and a flower production business. She has been in business for many years now and she generates income to sustain the family’s needs. Because of the high demand of her business, she has applied for another loan from the cooperative to buy commodities for her sari-sari store business and to buy flower spray to generate income for the family. It is a big help for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy commodities for her sari-sari store business and to buy flower spray to generate income for the family.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina tiene 43 años de edad, es separada, vive en casa propia de material rustico vive con sus dos menores hijos de edad de 12 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran cursando nivel primario en el colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Florentina vive por más de 5 años en dicho caserío. Ella vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su distrito está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio; y está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Florentina es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad con una antigüedad del negocio de 2 años, así como también se dedica a la venta de animales menores (patosd, cuyes, conesjos, etc) con una antigüedad de 5 años; estas actividades las realiza en el caserío de Vista Alegre ambos negocios le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos como bebidas gaseosas, y otros con ello generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Florentina, 43, is separated and lives in her own house of rustic materials.  She lives with her two minor children, 12 and 9, who are in the primary level of the national college in the district of Pucara.  Florentina has lived for more than five year in this area.  She lives in the rural part of this district which has water and electricity services.  Her district is basically dedicated to agriculture, herding, and commerce and is located in the province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.
Florentina has been making a living from the sale of articles of primary necessity for two years.  She has also been selling small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, etc.) for five years.  She conducts these activities in the hamlet of Vista Alegre.  Both businesses will allow her to cover the loan without any problem.  The object of the loan will be to invest in her business by stocking it with new products like soft drinks and other things with which to generate better income and thus improve her quality of life.  For this line of work, there no better competition in the zone and with this she will obtain the best prices.

loans.use: to invest in her business by stocking it with new products.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school. Cirila has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. Cirila has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 56 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed, with five children now at their adult age. 

Alejandra has been engaged in a RTW (ready-to-wear) and cosmetics direct-selling business for one year already. She earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is so helpful to support her financial needs. At present, she is also receiving a monthly pension as the surviving spouse of her late husband. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of RTW and cosmetics for sale. The income from the business also helps a lot in supporting the educational needs of her grandchildren.

Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Alejandra hopes to expand her RTW and cosmetics direct-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of RTW (ready-to-wear) and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 33 years old and has two children. Bernard personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  

Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing for almost three years. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 50,000 for the purchase of new nets and to repair the fishing vessel. 

He dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. He wishes to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and repair the fishing vessel.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her food stall.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is 36 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Socorro works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Ma. Socorro aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Riza

texts.en:
Maria Riza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Maria Riza has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Maria Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a native of Carles, Iloilo. In this place, fishing businesses thrive for being near the seaside. 

Maricel is married, and her husband is a fisherman. She also helps in fishing. For the last ten years, this has been her main source of income to support her three children, ages six, eight, and nine. 

Maricel is asking for a loan to further finance her business. She will use it to buy floaters, fishing nets, ropes, and nylon. 

Maricel hopes to see her business grow someday, and for her children to continue schooling and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy floaters, fishing nets, ropes and nylon.,

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 43 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business, farming calamansi in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Divina has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 59 years old and married, with six children, one of whom is in school. Felipa works very hard to provide for them.

Felipa runs a general srore in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Felipa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and school supplies. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae is 24 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Sheila Mae has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.  In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 31, and married with three school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for seven years already. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children and their health needs. 

She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already has used previous loans to purchase additional stock and now she is applying for another loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Christine Joy

texts.en: Christine Joy is managing her eatery business in Palayan, Aloran. It has been doing well supporting her needs, and she is able to sustain the needs of her parents as well. She has local customers and she also accepts catering, for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl, 25 years old, is married and has one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past two years, Cheryl has operated a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 39 years old, is married and has seven children, five of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Elizabeth has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en: Sreysros is a 19-year-old garment-factory worker, and a freshman at a university. Her major is banking and finance. She lives in Svay Reang Province of Cambodia. She works from Monday to Friday earning approximately $5 per day, and she goes to university on Saturday and Sunday. Because of a shortage of financial support, she would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees. This loan will help her to finish the first year successfully. After graduation, she wants to find a better job in any bank, and she also wants to own a house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, 41 years old, is married and has six children, three of them currently in school. Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

For the past 6 years, Emelia has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, etc. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more of these items to sell. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita, 41 years old, is married and has eight children, three of them currently in school. Estrellita works very hard to provide for them.

For the past 10 years, Estrellita has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, chocolate drinks, etc. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Dudima

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Dudima works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Dudima is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gabina works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and ready-to-wear clothing businesses. Gabina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Gabina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 49 years old, married, and has six children. Two of her children are in school.

Ninfa is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Ninfa has been raising livestock for ten years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 grazing cows to sell after one year.

loans.name: Divino Maestro Group

texts.en:
The village of Patachaj, in the Department of Totonicapan in the southwestern highlands of Guatemala, has a cold and wet climate and beautiful landscapes. The villagers produce textiles on a grand scale. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Divine Maestro” (Divine Teacher) is located here.

Leticia is the Trust Bank secretary. She is 29 years old and has two beautiful children who are attending school. Leticia and her small family make sports attire, such as pants, shorts and sports shirts. In the spirit of bettering the quality and quantity of her merchandise production, she joined “Divino Maestro”. Now, she is about to begin her third loan cycle, which she will use to purchase quality fabric so she can continue with her production. Leticia is very excited at the prospect of acquiring new ideas, as well as knowledge, through the non-formal education program of Friendship Bridge.

The members of “Divine Maestro”, along with Leticia, are asking KIVA investors to finance a new line of credit which they will apply to making textiles. A majority of the funds will be used to purchase thread, needles, dyes and cloth. The ladies, without doubt, know that the ability to receive credit and education through Friendship Bridge has transformed the lives of the Maya women of Guatemala. They are extremely grateful for the non-formal education provided in many important subjects such as accounting, budgeting, customer service, health and hygiene, self-esteem and empowerment. The knowledge they receive has helped them find their own solutions to overcoming poverty. Thank you KIVA investors for making this possible!!!

loans.use: to purchase quality fabric so she can continue with her production

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem, 43 years old, has four children and resides in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she earns income by growing cassava and rice. This is Khem's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. Khem will use her entire loan to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's Degree majoring in Mathematics. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mona Liza

texts.en:
Mona Liza is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She has been in this business for more than 5 years now.

Mona Liza is asking for a loan to purchase more stock to sell like rice, noodles, canned goods, soap, detergents, cooking oil and condiments. This loan will help improve her stock which will attract more buyers to her store.

In the future, Mona Liza hopes to make her business sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like rice, noodles, canned goods, soap, detergents, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Judit

texts.en: Judit, 38 years old, is married and has 2 children. She previously often helped her husband working and raising pigs until she became engaged in retailing goods for more income. Judit's husband now earns an income from his business providing transportation. Judit borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase more varieties of grocery goods to sell in her store. She hopes to expand her business and build a bigger shelter for her convenience store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of grocery goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila has been operating her tailoring business to make a living. She was thankful to GDMPC for the capital entrusted to her in order to improve her business for she solely provides for the needs of her family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. 

To improve her services, she took a new loan recently to buy machine parts, repair and maintenance costs to improve her sewing activities. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions by improving her business first and hopes to be able to buy another sewing machine as an expansion.

loans.use: to pay for machine parts, repair and maintenance which will improve her sewing activities.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice, 33 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. For the past five years, Janice has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Janice is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn 42 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. Madelyn has been farming bananas in the Philippines for 15 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Madelyn has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Noeme requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Noeme would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Radina

texts.en: Radina is 19 years old, a second-year university student and her major is banking and finance. She lives in the Svay Reang province of Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, she would like to secure a loan to pay for her tuition fee for a year. This loan will help her to finish the second year successfully. After graduation, she hopes to have a good job with reasonable salary to help her parents. She also wants her own house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Takeo province, Chantha, 50, is a mother of four children; three of whom are in school and one is in university. To support her living, she weaves Khmer skirts (Cambodian called Hul). Moreover, she can earn more income via rice cropping to update her family's condition. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree majoring in Nursing. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue her bachelor's degree majoring in nursing.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Battambang province, Han is 47 years old and a mother of three children. For her living, she grows rice on two hectares as her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. For Han, this is her fifth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In the group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to pay plowing fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can harvest her rice on time.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees to support her farmland.

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en: Hean, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 28 years old and a windowed mother blessed with a young kid. To improve her family's condition, she grows rice on two hectares. Moreover, she can earn extra income via raising ducks. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and duck feed. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and duck feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 26 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Andrea runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Andrea would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 58 years old and a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Rosalia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rosalia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, and spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

Arlene has been in this business for 19 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, and spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom, 59, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children. She earns income to support her family condition via growing cassava on two hectares.  Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn more income. For Rom, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get a bigger yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa, 24, is the father of two young children living in Kampong Chhnang province. He struggles for a living via grocery item selling and rice cropping to earn more income. This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to buy solar panels. He hopes that he can improve his family's living so they have electricity to use like other families.

loans.use: to buy solar panels.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kandal province, Touch is 44 years old and a mother of two children; one of whom is in school, and other one is in university. She supports her family's condition via rice cropping and wrought iron. She can earn income of about 6.08 USD per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Touch will spend her loan portion to pay tuition for her daughter, who wants pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughter, who wants pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a responsible mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She is 43 years old and has two children. Due to the hardship of living, she aims to further improve her business to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000 to buy more canned goods, assorted candies, noodles, beverages, snack foods, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. Having this financial assistance, she is hoping that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, assorted candies, noodles, beverages, snack foods, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one daughter and four sons now at their adult age. 

Elizabeth is earning income from her little sari-sari store. She’s been engaged in this business for 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is so helpful to support their family needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for retail.
 
Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Clara works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Clara is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shirts, sandals, etc. to sell. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Clara has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shirts and sandals to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Estrella works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Estrella is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products. Gina is borrowing PHP 14,500 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like pants, shirts, bags, etc for her buy and sell ready to wear products business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like pants, shirts, bags, etc

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 60-year-old married woman. She has been involved in a business of cattle purchase and sales, with the help of her son, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of two children. She is very motivated to provide them all facilities including good education, food, health and clothing. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle, and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase more cattle in order to increase her sales and revenues. 

She is hopeful that this loan amount will help her to increase her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle in order to increase her sales and revenues.

loans.name: Jojin

texts.en:
Jojin is 52 years old, and married with five children, three of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

Jojin has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 54-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small retail shop at her house with her husband (as shown in the picture). They have 12 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her in purchase of stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.
