She is a mother of four children, and motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She is in her third loan cycle.  

Nusrat wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sugar, rice, milk and beverages to fulfill the increasing demand in her store. 

She is expecting that this loan amount will boost their earnings, and their dream of expanding their business in the future may come true.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sugar, rice, milk and beverages

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 43-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married with six children, ages 8 to 19. Milagros' husband is a fisherman. As a wife, Milagros helps by ensuring that what he needs in fishing has been prepared; she also takes care of his catch. 

Milagros is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, and a power generator to generate electricity in her household.  

In the future, Milagros dreams of seeing more progress in her place, living in comfort, and her children becoming successful.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a generator

loans.name: Jorem

texts.en:
Jorem is 35 years old and lives in Doña Josefa, Sindangan. He is married with two children. Jorem feeds his family through his fishing activities. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase a generator set, fuel, and a fishing boat for his deep sea fishing. 

Jorem has been a member of Paglaum MPC for three years. 

In the future, Jorem would like to add more units of fishing boats for more income, and would be happy to be of help to others.

loans.use: to purchase a generator set, fuel, and a fishing boat for his deep sea fishing

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Resyl

texts.en:
Resyl is a 27-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a food vending business, selling pork barbecue or grilled pork. She has been in the business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Resyl is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, cooking oil and condiments, rice, ketchup and charcoal. This loan will enable her to cook more food to sell to her customers.

In the future, Resyl hopes to make her business sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, cooking oil and condiments, rice, ketchup and charcoal

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and a general store. Emelia is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 39-year-old vigorous lady. She has been providing services of stitching clothes for many years. Her customers are the people of her community. 

Shehnaz uses this income which she generates from her business to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the regular demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons. 

She is in her fpurth loan cycle, and her previous credit record is satisfactory.

loans.use: to buy more thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en: Shafqat is a 46-year-old woman who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches the clothes of the people of her community and uses this income to support her family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to fulfill all the orders of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use the loan to buy more threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to boost her earnings. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy more thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to boost her earnings

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is 54 years old, and married with seven children.

Fermina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Fermina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita earns a living by selling dried fish. She is from Sindangan, where fish are abundant. She makes dried fish by herself, and earns more out from it. She is now increasing her inventories by buying more kilos of fish and salt. She learned the craft from her parents, who are into fishing. 

Now she applied a loan to build bamboo nets and a stall where she can sun dry her fish. 

In the future, Nenita wants to buy a motorcycle for easy transport of her retailing business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo for dried fish

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Ma. Elsa

texts.en:
Ma. Elsa is 54 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, noodles, soap, shampoo, chips, etc.

Ma. Elsa has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Ma. Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, noodles, soap, shampoo, chips, etc

loans.name: Kalsoum

texts.en:
Kalsoum is a 39-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling, with the help of her husband, for many years. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother, and wants the best for her children. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. 

She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan, and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Dmitriy has grown vegetables in greenhouses at his hometown of Gladkovka over 20 years. He grows late and early tomatoes, peppers, radishes and potatoes.

Due to previous loan Dmitriy bought plastic sheeting, fertilizers, seeds, and also heated the greenhouses and made minor repairs where necessary. 

This time Dmitriy is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to build two greenhouses. He wants to build first one instead the old greenhouse, and the second one will be new. Dmitriy hopes to get bigger harvest and increase his income.
texts.en:
Dmitriy has grown vegetables in greenhouses in his hometown of Gladkovka for over 20 years. He grows late and early tomatoes, peppers, radishes and potatoes.

Due to a previous loan, Dmitriy bought plastic sheeting, fertilizers, seeds, and also heated the greenhouses and made minor repairs where necessary.

This time Dmitriy is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to build two greenhouses. He wants to build the first one instead of the old greenhouse, and the second one will be new. Dmitriy hopes to get a bigger harvest and increase his income.

loans.use: to build two greenhouses

loans.name: Qurat Ulain

texts.en:
Qurat Ulain is a married woman, and has been providing the services of a beauty parlor for last six years. She is doing her job passionately. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials, etc.  She has become very famous in her town because she is providing quality services. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling. She also provides bangles, jewelry, mehndi, etc. to her customers. 

Qurat Ulain is a responsible mother of two children. She is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including hair care products, lotions, makeup kits, bleaching, and whitening cream, etc. The loan will enable her to cater a large number of customers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including hair care products, lotions, makeup kits, bleaching and whitening cream etc.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 31 years old, with two children.  Arnel personally sells the catch from his fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing for almost three years. 

Arnel wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 14,900 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, he has to have all the neccesary fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. 

He already has floaters to help guard fish cages. He also wants to buy the fish catch of his neighbors, so he can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. He wishes to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

loans.name: Sunatillo

texts.ru: Сунатилло в возрасте 43 лет начинает собственный бизнес. Его интересует купля и продажа одежды, а именно детской и взрослой. Сунатилло в данный момент нигде не работает, он всецело поглащен открытием нового бизнеса. Сунатилло на свои сбережения приобрел торговую точку на рынке и уже составил свой бизнес-план. Рассчитав свои расходы он пришел к выводу, что ему не хватает еще немного средств, чтобы привезти товар для продажи. Для этой цели он обратился за кредитом. Сунатилло будет привозить свой товар с города Душанбе оптом и продавать на рынке своего района Шахритус по розничной цене. В ассортименте его товара будут и детские и возрослые одежды, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Он надеется, что новый бизнес принесет ему успех в финансовом смыслн.
texts.en: Sunatillo is 43 years old and plans to start a new business.  He's interested in buying and selling clothing items, particularly children's and adults' clothes.  At the moment, Sunatillo is not working anywhere; he is thoroughly focused on starting his new business.  With his savings, he has already purchased a retail outlet at the market and has put a business plan in place.  After calculating his costs, he has come to the conclusion that he is still lacking a small amount of money to bring merchandise for resale, and this is the reason why he has requested a loan.  He will be bringing goods from the city of Dushanbe and reselling them on a retail basis at a local market in the Shahrituz district.  His inventory will include clothes for children and adults, which will allow him to attract more customers.  He is hopeful that this new business will enable him to prosper financially.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of clothes for children and adults, so that he can start a new business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 51 years old, is married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold at a public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years, already. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market.

Delia and her husband agreed to join PMPC to obtain a loan, because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But in addition to the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits, like insurance and savings.

Now, Delia has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy her fish to resell at the market. She is looking forward to being a successful vendor and owning a stall at the public market someday, with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband.

loans.use: to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk to resell at a public market.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es:
Jimena es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de un año y su negocio es la atención de un snack de comida rápida.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, responsable, buena madre y muy activa. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas de clima cálido con una temperatura aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Jimena es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español. su vida la comparte con su hijo que se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en casa de sus padres que es propia y de ladrillo y tiene agua potable y luz eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, refrescos, licuados de fruta, masitas, etc. en un pequeño snack dentro del mercado. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y que sea propio, ella desea realizar una inversión en la compra de un refrigerador y un juego de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes de mejor manera.
Es por esos motivos que Jimena solicita un préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador y muebles para su snack.
texts.en:
Jimena is a 21-year-old, single woman with a son, and her business is serving fast-food snacks. She is independent, hard-working, responsible, a good mother and very active. Her business is in the 'Plan 3000' zone, known for its commerce in all areas of this hot climate, with a temperature of approximately 30 degrees centigrade year round. 

Jimena is dark-skinned, of medium stature, with long black hair. Her mother tongue is Quechua and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her son who is still in her care. They live in her parents brick house and they have potable water and electric lights. Her business is selling fast food, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and snacks in a small stall in the market.

This is her first loan with the institution in the two years it has been involved in this activity. 

Jimena's dream is to expand her business and to make improvements. She wishes to make an investment in purchasing a refrigerator and set of tables and chairs to attend to more customer in a better manner. It is for these reasons that Jimena is requesting a loan, to purchase a refrigerator and furnishings for her snack shop.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and tables and chairs for her snack shop.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities, from growing and caring, to harvesting, and earning income, as well. Julieta has supported her husband doing this type of work. As a farmer, Julieta has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds. She hopes she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Julieta hopes to purchase another rice land. To cultivate that would potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Ma. Luna has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for 10 years and also earns an income from general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Ep Bukavu Group

texts.fr: Le client ZAGABE est âgé de 51 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants tous fréquentant à l’école. En son état d’enseignant, Il est président du groupe de crédit EP BUKAVU. Il vient solliciter un prêt dans l’objectif de réfectionner sa maison. A cet effet, il remercie IMF HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux enseignants dans la réalisation de leur projet.
texts.en: ZAGABE is 51 years old, married, and the father of six children who all attend school.  He is a teacher and the president of the EP BUKAVU credit group.  He is taking a loan to renovate his house.  He is thankful to the micro-finance organization Hekima for the support it provides to teachers, for the implementation of their projects.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Faroukou

texts.fr: Revendeur de viande de bœuf et chèvre au marché, Faroukou pour satisfaire ses clients sollicite un second crédit à WAGES. Il à l'avenir devenir un grossiste et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Âgée de 27ans, il est marié et et père de famille.
texts.en: Faroukou is a reseller of beef and goat meat at the market.  In order to meet the needs of his customers, he is taking a second loan from WAGES.  In the future, he would like to become a wholesaler and better provide for his family.  Faroukou is 27 years old and he has a family of his own.

loans.use: to buy beef and goat meat to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelyn de 35 años de edad es una mujer luchadora que se esfuerza cada día dando lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera y prestando sus servicios domésticos. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que es muy conocida en su cantón, junto a ella habitan sus 3 hijos y un nieto, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con su familia, que ha sacado adelante a base de esfuerzo. Evelyn ha logrado levantar las paredes de su vivienda, pero no alcanzo a instalar techo, ventanas y puertas a su vivienda, es por ello que Evelyn solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ventanas, puertas, lámina, polines y pines para instalar ventanas, puertas y un techo a su vivienda.
texts.en: Evelyn, who is 35 years old, is a hard-working woman who exerts herself every day, giving her best in order to raise her children. She is a single mother and provides domestic services. She has lived in her own house for a long time, and so she is very well known in her canton. Along with her live her three children and a grandson. She feels very happy to be able to have her family, which she has raised on the basis of her effort. Evelyn has managed to raise the walls of her house, but she doesn't have enough to install the roof, windows, and doors. It is for that reason that Evelyn is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in windows, doors, metal sheeting, purlins, and pins in order to install windows, doors, and a roof in her house.

loans.use: to invest in windows, doors, metal sheeting, purlins, and pins to install windows, doors, and a roof on her house.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is a factory worker, age 34. He lives in Cavite, Philippines with his wife and two children. He has been in the service for two years through the aid of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Charlie works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor. He directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Charlie, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Charlie is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. He looks forward to your positive response, and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to pay for his balances for their housing expense, and also to pay his other debt.

Charlie hopes to give his children a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for his housing expenses and other debt.

loans.name: Glory Stella

texts.en:
Glory Stella is 45 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Glory Stella is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 32 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Glory Stella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is 41 years old, a married lady, and is running a small general store in her community. She has been doing this work for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Haleema makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She will use it to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour. She will buy these things from the market at lower prices, to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand, consistently. Haleema wishes to use part of her revenues on providing a good-quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy several food products from the market at lower prices, making enough stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 58 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has five children. She has a shop that sells sacks of rice; she has had this business for three years. She wants to buy a hectare of land and to engage in farming activity on her own. She requested a loan, to pay for land and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season. Growing rice will be another source of income for her children. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Vilma hopes to have her own jeepney for her business service.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, eggs, etc., for her restaurant business. In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, eggs, etc., for her restaurant business

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is 36 years old, a married woman, and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She will use it to purchase another buffalo, to grow her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo, to grow her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to construct her house.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina has been  running a grocery store in order to provide for the needs of her four children. She sells assorted groceries in their village to make a living. Her husband helps her in operating her business in his vacant time. 

Her previous loan, used for the business, has been repaid successfully. To improve sales, she took another loan to buy additional products like livestock feeds and rice to offer more to her customers. In the future, Adelina wants to improve the general living situation by renovating their house for the safer and more comfortable living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional products like livestock feeds and rice to offer more to her customers

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallon to sell.

Nelfa has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Nena has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 31-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with the help of her husband for many years. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock (shampoo, soap, spices, etc.).  Sonia has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Sonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as shampoo, soap, and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Being a responsible house wife, Mirriam has been engaged in reselling fruits and vegetables within the public market for almost six years. It is her way of helping her husband in gaining income to sustain the necessities of her family and finance the education of her five children. 

She wants to acquire more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP10,000.00 to buy more stocks of garlic, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, broccoli ,and eggplants to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, Mirriam believes that, someday, she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of garlic, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, broccoli, and eggplants to resell

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Perez, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Gene is a fisherman who catches and sells fish, crab, and sea shells. This is his main source of income.  He is married and a father of four-year-old-child.  Together with his family, he lives in Dulag, Leyte. He has been engaged in this kind of business for four years. 

Gene has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fishing net and an engine for the motorboat. These will help Gene improve his method of fishing so he would be at ease in transporting his daily catch.
 
In the future, Gene would like to expand his fishing business to alleviate his livelihood status for the welfare of his growing child.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and an engine for the motorboat

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a married, 45-year-old woman with three children in school.  She and her husband aimed to improve their status of living and to educate their children so as to provide them a better living. Due to the high cost of school fees, they cannot afford to finance the education of their children. For this reason, Imelda wants to access educational assistance from Kiva lenders.  She requests a PHP 20,000 loan to pay for tuition and additional fees for her eldest son, who is working toward a B.S. degree in Criminology. She is hoping to receive this loan to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for educational fees.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing. Merlie is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shirts, shorts, etc., to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear products business.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shirts, shorts, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Jacinta requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future, Jacinta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Adelina works hard to support her family. She has a rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Adelina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting another loan to further build her business. Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is a 26-year-old woman who is married to a motorcycle driver.  They are blessed with two children. She owns and manages a motorcycle transport in their village and earns a net income of PHP 300-500 daily. Her net income from the business is usually spent on their daily expenses and electric bills. She also has a retail store to earn additional income. Due to insufficient funds she would like to borrow a PHP 13,000 loan to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Jessiel

texts.en:
Jessiel is 31 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. Jessiel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, like candies, snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, and juice. Jessiel has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items.

Jessiel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase candies, snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, and juice.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 54 years old and married with four children.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos,  ambos trabajan para tener recursos económicos con los que cubren las necesidades familiares, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; ella tiene una tortillería en la que trabaja de 7:00 a.m.  a 12:00 p.m. y de 1:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m., el negocio tiene 10 años de estar funcionando.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar maíz y leña, tendrá materia prima para continuar elaborando la venta de tortillas, esperando tener una mayor productividad, nuevos clientes y seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su familia.
Félix anhela cancelar sus deudas, mantener su negocio  y dar a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Félix is married. She lives with her husband and three children. Both work in order to have economic resources to cover the family necessities. She doesn't have any family living abroad. She has a tortilla stand where she works from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. and from 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. The business has been functioning for 10 years.

She is applying for a loan to buy corn and firewood. She will have basic materials to continue making tortillas to sell, hoping to have greater productivity and new customers and continue working in order to get ahead with her family.

Félix dreams of paying off her debts, maintaining her business, and giving her family the best.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, so that she will have the basic materials to continue making tortillas to sell
